commit_message:
shared policy shouldn't have unshared rules

A shared firewall policy should always have shared rules. So the following
cases should not be allowed:
1.Create shared policy with unshared rules
2.Update policy shared=True when it has unshared rules
3.Update policy with shared=True and unshared rules
4.Update shared policy with unshared rules

Change-Id: I3d71899c328d3fefa96c1f99d6ba706160e445cc
Closes-bug: 1334981
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/115912/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_shared_firewall_policy_with_unshared_rule(self): with self.firewall_rule(shared=False) as fwr: fw_rule_ids = [fwr['firewall_rule']['id']] res = self._create_firewall_policy( None, 'firewall_policy1', description=DESCRIPTION, shared=True, firewall_rules=fw_rule_ids, audited=AUDITED) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 409) def test_update_shared_firewall_policy_with_unshared_rule(self): with self.firewall_rule(name='fwr1', shared=False) as fr: with self.firewall_policy() as fwp: fw_rule_ids = [fr['firewall_rule']['id']] # update shared policy with unshared rule data = {'firewall_policy': {'firewall_rules': fw_rule_ids}} req = self.new_update_request('firewall_policies', data, fwp['firewall_policy']['id']) res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 409) def test_update_firewall_policy_with_shared_attr_unshared_rule(self): with self.firewall_rule(name='fwr1', shared=False) as fr: with self.firewall_policy(shared=False) as fwp: fw_rule_ids = [fr['firewall_rule']['id']] # update shared policy with shared attr and unshared rule data = {'firewall_policy': {'shared': True, 'firewall_rules': fw_rule_ids}} req = self.new_update_request('firewall_policies', data, fwp['firewall_policy']['id']) res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 409) def test_update_firewall_policy_with_shared_attr(self): with self.firewall_rule(name='fwr1', shared=False) as fr: fw_rule_ids = [fr['firewall_rule']['id']] with self.firewall_policy(shared=False, firewall_rules=fw_rule_ids) as fwp: # update policy with shared attr data = {'firewall_policy': {'shared': True}} req = self.new_update_request('firewall_policies', data, fwp['firewall_policy']['id']) res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 409)

commit_message:
Allow to specify policy by name in firewall-update

Currently only firewall policy ids are supported in firewall-update,
this change allows to use firewall policy names in firewall-update:

  neutron firewall-update my-firewall --policy my-new-policy

DocImpact
Change-Id: I84ad97fc7f1f2e81cad98497d4d983606fa03077

commit_message:
Clean-up shell run and run_subcommand methods

Remove else branch of try-catch block since
it is never executed.

Get rid of passing result to shell clean-up function
since it is not used.

Change-Id: I9360d1e27fc203672ba0511b58172f5c776bdfb6

commit_message:
Silence iso8601 debug messages in verbose mode

In verbose mode, iso8601 package produces the following useless debug
messages:

DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got u'2014' for 'year' with default None
DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got u'09' for 'monthdash' with default 1
DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got 9 for 'month' with default 9
DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got u'14' for 'daydash' with default 1
DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got 14 for 'day' with default 14
DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got u'16' for 'hour' with default None
DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got u'31' for 'minute' with default None
DEBUG: iso8601.iso8601 Got u'23' for 'second' with default None

This change silences them.

Change-Id: Ibd0c5bb48b1ab86aaee2c8cb4f27b7e5fa8b4bef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/08/121508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Correct baremetal/ironic consume_from_instance...

In 2bc74e66d90b6fae3c5ca8f79f99e75169da644f we recently changed
the HostState.consume_from_instance method parameters to include a
context. This patch updates the relevate baremetal/ironic host state
classes to do likewise.

This fixes a critical TypeError that occurs when trying to use
Ironic or Nova Baremetal otherwise.

Change-Id: I46eebce19603cb4c4a934b1647ff6433d75799ad
Closes-bug: #1369151

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:48:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/64548420c87f3163ed543c9e9a02a4f1abec69e0', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/18/121318/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: extensions = ['sphinx.ext.autodoc',
deleted_lines: extensions = ['sphinx.ext.autodoc', 'sphinx.ext.intersphinx', # Example configuration for intersphinx: refer to the Python standard library. intersphinx_mapping = {'python': ('http://docs.python.org/', None), 'nova': ('http://nova.openstack.org', None), 'glance': ('http://glance.openstack.org', None)}

commit_message:
Add validate alarm_actions schema in alarm API

Currently, alarm API does not validate schema in alarm_actions.
When invalid schema is specified, error occurs later in alarm notifier.
Schema should be validated in advance in API.

Change-Id: I3b28cfe36c460daead2945ba3577fbc1274f9d91
Closes-bug: #1342673

commit_message:
Add unit-test assert to check dict is superset of dict

Several VPN unit tests need the ability to check that an expected
dict is found in the actual dict output (and that other elements are
ignored - like auth tokens).

Since this will be of use to other components, adding this to the
base test case.

Note: There is a similar assertDictContainsSubset(), however, it is
not supported in 2.6 and has been deprecated in 3.2. A different, and
hopefully clearer, name is used for this method.

Change-Id: I8becf9cfad966874f8463a9c835331f2f17d2ead
Closes-Bug: 1366797
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/119779/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def assertDictSupersetOf(self, expected_subset, actual_superset): """Checks that actual dict contains the expected dict. After checking that the arguments are of the right type, this checks that each item in expected_subset is in, and matches, what is in actual_superset. Separate tests are done, so that detailed info can be reported upon failure. """ if not isinstance(expected_subset, dict): self.fail("expected_subset (%s) is not an instance of dict" % type(expected_subset)) if not isinstance(actual_superset, dict): self.fail("actual_superset (%s) is not an instance of dict" % type(actual_superset)) for k, v in expected_subset.iteritems(): self.assertIn(k, actual_superset) self.assertEqual(v, actual_superset[k], "Key %(key)s expected: %(exp)r, actual %(act)r" % {'key': k, 'exp': v, 'act': actual_superset[k]})

commit_message:
Fix 'simple_flat_node_deletion' test

In the simple cluster configuration it is impossible
to remove a single controller now. So let's delete
a compute node instead.

Change-Id: I902200fbbd7096f4039b18a0a59fc2eab692c0cf
Closes-bug: #1368820

This patch adds a SoftwareComponent resource for defining
configurations for a software component's different lifecycle
actions.

The current patch only adds the basic code for the resource and
initial test code. A subsequent patch in this chain will add more

sure that not more than one config is defined for one lifecycle
action.

The current patch only adds the basic code for the resource and
initial test code. A subsequent patch in this chain will add more
validation (beyond basic property schema validation), e.g. to make
sure that not more than one config is defined for one lifecycle

commit_message:
Add OS::Heat::SoftwareComponent resource

This patch adds a SoftwareComponent resource for defining
configurations for a software component's different lifecycle
actions.

The current patch only adds the basic code for the resource and
initial test code. A subsequent patch in this chain will add more
validation (beyond basic property schema validation), e.g. to make
sure that not more than one config is defined for one lifecycle
action.

Implements: partial-blueprint action-aware-sw-config

Change-Id: Idd9de7edf3bab99f26911a0d018a1d433381deb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/52/112952/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import heatclient.exc as heat_exp from heat.engine import constraints as constr from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine.resource import Resource from heat.engine.resources.software_config import software_config as sc class SoftwareComponent(sc.SoftwareConfig): ''' A resource for describing and storing a software component. This resource is similar to OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig. In contrast to SoftwareConfig which allows for storing only one configuration (e.g. one script), SoftwareComponent allows for storing multiple configurations to address handling of all lifecycle hooks (CREATE, UPDATE, SUSPEND, RESUME, DELETE) for a software component in one place. This resource is backed by the persistence layer and the API of the SoftwareConfig resource, and only adds handling for the additional 'configs' property and attribute. ''' PROPERTIES = ( CONFIGS, INPUTS, OUTPUTS, OPTIONS, ) = ( 'configs', 'inputs', 'outputs', 'options' ) CONFIG_PROPERTIES = ( CONFIG_ACTIONS, CONFIG_CONFIG, CONFIG_TOOL, ) = ( 'actions', 'config', 'tool', ) ATTRIBUTES = ( CONFIGS_ATTR, ) = ( 'configs', ) # properties schema for one entry in the 'configs' list config_schema = properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, schema={ CONFIG_ACTIONS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('Lifecycle actions to which the configuration applies.'), schema=properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, constraints=[ constr.AllowedValues(allowed=[ Resource.CREATE, Resource.DELETE, Resource.UPDATE, Resource.SUSPEND, Resource.RESUME]), ] ), constraints=[ constr.Length(min=1), ], required=True ), CONFIG_CONFIG: sc.SoftwareConfig.properties_schema[ sc.SoftwareConfig.CONFIG ], CONFIG_TOOL: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The configuration tool used to actually apply the ' 'configuration on a server. This string property has ' 'to be understood by in-instance tools running inside ' 'deployed servers.'), required=True ) } ) properties_schema = { CONFIGS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('The list of configurations for the different lifecycle actions ' 'of the represented software component.'), schema=config_schema, constraints=[constr.Length(min=1)], required=True ), INPUTS: sc.SoftwareConfig.properties_schema[ sc.SoftwareConfig.INPUTS], OUTPUTS: sc.SoftwareConfig.properties_schema[ sc.SoftwareConfig.OUTPUTS], OPTIONS: sc.SoftwareConfig.properties_schema[ sc.SoftwareConfig.OPTIONS], } def _resolve_attribute(self, name): ''' Retrieve attributes of the SoftwareComponent resource. 'configs' returns the list of configurations for the software component's lifecycle actions. If the attribute does not exist, an empty list is returned. ''' if name == self.CONFIGS_ATTR and self.resource_id: try: return self.heat().software_configs.get(self.resource_id).\ configs except heat_exp.HTTPNotFound: # TODO(tspatzier) rebase to stavebacker's client exception # handling patch as soon as it is merged return None def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Heat::SoftwareComponent': SoftwareComponent, }

commit_message:
Enabled Cisco ML2 driver to use new upstream ncclient

The code is still able to handle the old, custom ncclient that
we used before. It uses the different function signatures
for the ncclient's connect() function to detect which version
is installed.

Change-Id: I09d81b424d86f4cd35ca048507f06471246b91d8
Closes-Bug: 1352635

commit_message:
Add support for token validation

Support for both token validation methods, the one that returns a set of
permissions and one that simply returns a True/False based on whether
the token is valid.

Change-Id: Ib1066a733ed396f05c0f354b93b0a697a0a6acc1
Closes-Bug: #1313264
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/98/104998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate(self, token, belongs_to=None): url = "/tokens/%s" % base.getid(token) if belongs_to: url += "?belongsTo=%s" % belongs_to return self._get(url, "access") def validate_quick(self, token, belongs_to=None): """Return True if the token validates (optionally within the specified tenant), and False if the token is not found or does not match the optionally specified tenant. """ url = "/tokens/%s" % base.getid(token) if belongs_to: url += "?belongsTo=%s" % belongs_to return self._head(url)

commit_message:
add bp:resource-cleanup

Change-Id: I6d6c066edda28d261ec1e9aba8e4000648a17f42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/52/118352/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ================ Resource Cleanup ================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/resource-cleanup Tempest test resource cleanup Problem description =================== The cleanup/release of test resources created/allocated in the class level test fixtures is invoked in the class level tearDown fixure. However tearDownClass is invoked by the unittest framework only in case setUpClass is successful. This is causing resources being leaked when: - a skip exception is raised after resources (typically test accounts) have already been allocated - there is a temporary failure in the system under test which causes the setUpClass to fail The test-accounts bp introduces the possibility to run parallel tests using a configured list of pre-provisioned test accounts. Test accounts are allocated and released by each test class, and a failure to release leads to exhaustion of test accounts. Proposed change =============== Disallow overriding ``setUpClass`` defined in ``BaseTestCase``. Define ``setUpClass`` so that it calls one (or more) other methods to be overridden by descendants. Decorate it with the ``@safe_setup`` decorator. This way tearDownClass will always be invoked. While doing this change, an extra benefit could be gained by structuring the setup in a series of methods, to enforce the least possible resource allocation before failure and thus quick cleanup as well. :: @classmethod @safe_setup def setUpClass(cls): if hasattr(super(BaseTestCase, cls), 'setUpClass'): super(BaseTestCase, cls).setUpClass() cls.setUpClassCalled = True # All checks that may generate a skip cls.setup_skip_checks() # Any setup code that does not require / generate test resources cls.setup_pre_resources() # Allocation of all required credentials cls.setup_allocate_credentials() # Shortcuts to clients cls.setup_clients() # Allocation of shared test resources cls.setup_create_resources() # Any setup code to be run after resource allocation cls.setup_post_resources() .. PoC for this is available here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/115353. The tearDown fixture requireis fixing in several places, because several tearDownClass implementation would become unsafe, as they expect attributes defined during setUpClass, which may not be there anymore. Disallow overriding ``tearDownClass`` defined in ``BaseTestCase``. Define ``tearDownClass`` so that it invokes a descendant specifc cleanup code, and finally cleanup credentials. :: @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): at_exit_set.discard(cls) if hasattr(super(BaseTestCase, cls), 'tearDownClass'): super(BaseTestCase, cls).tearDownClass() cls.tear_down_class() cls._cleanup_credentials() # Defined in BaseTestCase .. Alternatives ------------ Two alternatives have been identified. Massive fixture decoration -------------------------- Decorate all ``setUpClass`` implementation with ``@safe_setup`` and all ``tearDownClass`` implementation with ``@safe_teardown``. This appraoch requires a mass change to tempest, which as the benefit of being almost scriptable (PoC: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/115123/). It has the downfall of requiring every new test class to add those two decorators. Migrate to TestResources ------------------------ This may still be an option on the long term, but at the moment the effort of the migration would be more than the benefit from it. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Andrea Frittoli <andrea.frittoli@hp.com> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-final Work Items ---------- - Define base fixtures - Migrate base classes and tests two use the new framework (multiple patches) Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Enhance SoftwareComponent property validation

This patch enhances the property validation for
OS::Heat::SoftwareComponent beyond what is done with property schema
validation. This allows for reporting additional validation errors
to users.

Implements: partial-blueprint action-aware-sw-config

Change-Id: I512c74341d9271bc07f78149d45d662484241ada
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/59/113259/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.common import exception def validate(self): '''Validate SoftwareComponent properties consistency.''' super(SoftwareComponent, self).validate() # One lifecycle action (e.g. CREATE) can only be associated with one # config; otherwise a way to defined ordering would be required. configs = self.properties.get(self.CONFIGS, []) config_actions = set() for config in configs: actions = config.get(self.CONFIG_ACTIONS) if any(action in config_actions for action in actions): msg = _('Defining more than one configuration for the same ' 'action in SoftwareComponent "%s" is not allowed.')\ % self.name raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) config_actions.update(actions)

subject: Enable SoftwareDeployment for SoftwareComponent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-08 15:48:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/28be4b5a8020aadc8531863ba9aa3eadbea87c74', 'message': "Enable SoftwareDeployment for SoftwareComponent

This patch enables the existing SoftwareDeployment resource to cope
with the new SoftwareComponent resource, i.e. allow for associating a
SoftwareComponent resource to a server via a SoftwareDeployment.

Main changes are:
(1) In case of a SoftwareComponent resource, look at the 'actions'
    lists of single configs to see when the the SoftwareDeployment
    should act (instead of looking at its own 'actions' property).
(2) Make sure that either the 'config' (in case of SoftwareConfig) or
    the 'configs' (in case of SoftwareComponent) property is copied
    to the derived software config that will be read by in-instance
    tools.

Note: to activate correct processing on a SoftwareComponent data on
an instance, an update to the os-collect-config plug-in
(55-heat-config) in the heat-templates repository is required. That
updated will be provided as a patch to heat-templates.

Change-Id: I45d4d373babe0fff9b109cba97ce7ebcb90562df
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-08 15:51:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/32ed12aa95e1d67c116717e7cbf08ad545eec1e7', 'message': "Enable SoftwareDeployment for SoftwareComponent

This patch enables the existing SoftwareDeployment resource to cope
with the new SoftwareComponent resource, i.e. allow for associating a
SoftwareComponent resource to a server via a SoftwareDeployment.

Main changes are:
(1) In case of a SoftwareComponent resource, look at the 'actions'
    lists of single configs to see when the the SoftwareDeployment
    should act (instead of looking at its own 'actions' property).
(2) Make sure that either the 'config' (in case of SoftwareConfig) or
    the 'configs' (in case of SoftwareComponent) property is copied
    to the derived software config that will be read by in-instance
    tools.

Note: to activate correct processing on a SoftwareComponent data on
an instance, an update to the os-collect-config plug-in
(55-heat-config) in the heat-templates repository is required. That
updated will be provided as a patch to heat-templates.

Implements: partial-blueprint action-aware-sw-config

Change-Id: I45d4d373babe0fff9b109cba97ce7ebcb90562df

commit_message:
Enable SoftwareDeployment for SoftwareComponent

This patch enables the existing SoftwareDeployment resource to cope
with the new SoftwareComponent resource, i.e. allow for associating a
SoftwareComponent resource to a server via a SoftwareDeployment.

In case of a SoftwareComponent resource, the SoftwareDeployment
resource will act at each resource action and create a derived
config to be passed to in-instances tools (instead of looking at its
own 'actions' property).

Note: to activate correct processing of SoftwareComponent data on
an instance, an additional os-collect-config plug-in similar to
55-heat-config will be implemented and posted to the heat-templates
repository. 55-heat-config will ignore configuration data with a
'group' property of 'component'.
The new in-instance hook will analyze component configurations,
derive the configuration to be applied based on the current resource
action and then invoke the appropriate configuration hook.

Implements: partial-blueprint action-aware-sw-config

Change-Id: I45d4d373babe0fff9b109cba97ce7ebcb90562df

added_lines: from heat.engine.resources.software_config import software_component as scomp def _get_derived_config(self, action, source_config): def _get_deploy_actions(self, config): ''' Get the set of actions upon which this deployment resource should act. The SoftwareDeployment resource will act upon certain resource actions, basically by providing updated information to in-instance tools via metadata. Those actions can be defined by means of the 'deploy_actions' property, or by an associated SoftwareComponent resource. SoftwareComponents define multiple configs, where each of those configs defines the action(s) to which it applies. ''' if config.configs is not None: actions = [] for c in config.configs: actions.extend(c[scomp.SoftwareComponent.CONFIG_ACTIONS]) return set(actions) return self.properties[self.DEPLOY_ACTIONS] def _handle_action(self, action): config_id = self.properties.get(self.CONFIG) config = self.heat().software_configs.get(config_id) if action not in self._get_deploy_actions(config): self._get_derived_config(action, config), compcl = scomp.SoftwareComponent # SoftwareDeployment can associate either a SoftwareConfig or a # SoftwareComponent to a server. Depending on which one is used, # one of derived_config or derived_configs below will be filled # with data. derived_configs = self._build_derived_configs( action, source, derived_inputs, derived_options) compcl.CONFIGS: derived_configs, def _build_derived_configs(self, action, source, derived_inputs, derived_options): return source.get(scomp.SoftwareComponent.CONFIGS)
deleted_lines: def _get_derived_config(self, action): source_config_id = self.properties.get(self.CONFIG) source_config = self.heat().software_configs.get(source_config_id) def _handle_action(self, action): if action not in self.properties[self.DEPLOY_ACTIONS]: self._get_derived_config(action),

commit_message:
Corrected dash.can_access call to take context

horizon_main_nav makes a call to dash.can_access which should take
context but was being passed the request, this patch corrects that.
Unit test added to prevent regression, and fix added to RbacHorizonTests
to clean up changes to Cats and Dogs test dashboards, as it was
affecting any test that followed.

Change-Id: I46d9880ba3ac46c23a8253a4afcf2c169d6f4dc8
Closes-Bug: 1368673

commit_message:
Adding django kwargs to login and logout views

The django.contrib.auth.views login and logout views take usefull parameters
which where dropped by the openstack_auth.views methods.

Added a TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN which allows to check token expiration minus a
time margin in seconds. This is usefull if you know a process will take a
certain time, you want to have your token still valid all this time (e.g. the
time it can take to render a view).

This patch is required for https://review.openstack.org/88220

Change-Id: I7508c40d6f1eaa2bf1eef5cc762052b15d6d9273
Closes-Bug: 1308918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/56/101556/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetime def check_token_expiration(token, margin=None): .. param:: token The openstack_auth.user.Token instance to check .. param:: margin A time margin in seconds to subtract from the real token's validity. An example usage is that the token can be valid once the middleware passed, and invalid (timed-out) during a view rendering and this generates authorization errors during the view rendering. A default margin can be set by the TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN in the django settings. if margin is None: margin = getattr(settings, 'TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN', 0) expiration = token.expires - datetime.timedelta(seconds=margin)

commit_message:
Switch to xstatic-bootstrap-datepicker

This points to datepicker 1.3.1 in xstatic.
Also fixes a couple of minor bugs in forms with
the new datepicker. The datepicker patch is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/116866/

Change-Id: I0a8cb7a16e50addbbdb10df8bdd4be427937bd81
Closes-Bug: 1361666

commit_message:
Installation Guide XML IDs change

Changing the XML IDs of several chapters in the installation
guide for consistency, and to match the section title, which
follows conventions. Minor subjective edits also included.

Change-Id: Id33aa27ef2027ac13f129c3bae150492b4bbfa13
backport:none
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix tox coverage job

To run the tempest unit tests with coverage enabled the coverage
module needs to be installed. This requirement is properly listed in
test-requirements.txt, however the coverage job definition wasn't
installing coverage. This commit fixes this oversight by adding the
test-requirements file as a dependency for the job.

Change-Id: Ic443c6c4a3166e6b198cbe2af0a77ff2f0a38e83

commit_message:
labs: make sysctl configuration survive reboots

Sysctl configuration set with "sysctl -w" does not survive reboots. Edit
/etc/sysctl.conf instead (and reload file with sysctl -p).

Change-Id: Icf0191774e0d1b8f65345cc980460ec8f86d7153
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/20/121420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cat << SYSCTL | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter=0 net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter=0 net.ipv4.ip_forward=1 SYSCTL # Reload changed file sudo sysctl -p
deleted_lines: sudo sysctl -w "net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter=0" sudo sysctl -w "net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter=0" sudo sysctl -w "net.ipv4.ip_forward=1"

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-12 20:50:38.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/b403416c4acb3d65dedf52fd6df7b55246fc8884', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This causes docs jobs to fail because we error out on warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This causes docs jobs to fail because we error out on warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:
Use central agent manager's keystone token in discoveries

Currently, EndpointDiscovery creates its own keystone client.
This patch passes an agent-manager reference into the discoveries,
enabling them to reuse the manager's keystone client and possibly
other things in the future.

Change-Id: I9875f15c4be25c2ac125458caa9a09927afdf3b2
Closes-bug: #1368125

commit_message:
Fix preparation of aki/ari/ami images on Ubuntu

The boto tests currently don't run because euca-bundle-image fails on
Ubuntu; e.g.

---
 ++ euca-bundle-image -r x86_64 \
  -i /opt/stack/new/devstack/files/images/cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec/cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-vmlinuz \
  --kernel true \
  -d /opt/stack/new/devstack/files/images/s3-materials/cirros-0.3.2

 euca-bundle-image: error: No such file or directory: /opt/stack/new/devstack/files/images/s3-materials/cirros-0.3.2
---

I noticed this in debugging why Fedora tests are running slower.  I
think that the version of euca-bundle-image in Fedora must create the
directory if it doesn't exist, while the Ubuntu one fails.

I also think this doesn't get caught by errexit because it's running
in a special sub-shell to use other credentials.

Change-Id: I79125e956088353aa76a3f7d6d81af1e4f6a27d4

Closes-Bug: #1367354
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-09 17:15:24.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/57f499eae5470dcebc10975e8d02ecedea3d624f', 'message': 'Add a check for SQLite transactional state

commit_message:
Add a check for SQLite transactional state

When we intercept SQLite transactions for BEGIN, check
a marker that we place there to indicate BEGIN has
already been called, which we then remove on commit or
rollback.  This is to resolve the issue of the fact
that we currently use the StaticPool implementation
with SQLite, which shares a single SQLite connection
for all requests; any API method which makes use
of multiple sessions at once (not a good idea, but
this is prevalent throughout nova, neutron) will
therefore share the same SQLite connection with
multiple SQLAlchemy Connection wrappers that are not
aware of the existing state.  While this practice
should be corrected, for now the marker, which is
local to the SQLite connection as stored by the
pool, will track when BEGIN is safe to call, or
has already been called.

Change-Id: I70d44104412bd99d8c7713eb6cd9ff0f80c5da34
Closes-Bug: #1367354
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/48/120148/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # emit our own BEGIN, checking for existing # transactional state if 'in_transaction' not in conn.info: conn.execute("BEGIN") conn.info['in_transaction'] = True @sqlalchemy.event.listens_for(engine, "rollback") @sqlalchemy.event.listens_for(engine, "commit") def _sqlite_end_transaction(conn): # remove transactional marker conn.info.pop('in_transaction', None)

commit_message:
Remove NotImplementedErrors from "virtual" methods

Raising a NotImplementedError in a method of a base class
makes it impossible to use super() with it and do multiple
inheritance properly. Those methods should instead simply
return some default "empty" value, so that the methods in
the subclasses can still call them, if that's where they
fall in the MRO.

Change-Id: I581391e87dc58f0f76adea3dbf90cef173d3daef
Closes-bug: 1278825

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/95/121295/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Six-ify error handling in heat-api* scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-15 08:39:45.000000000', 'files': ['bin/heat-api-cloudwatch', 'bin/heat-api-cfn', 'bin/heat-api'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/4d74af329406e908312765c61d0aa1e211774d7d', 'message': 'Six-ify error handling in heat-api* scripts

Allow for proper error propagation on startup in heat-api* scripts
when deployed on Python 2.6.

Change-Id: I63fd8d9cac73604438961966c5e9692a53771a18
Closes-Bug: #1369440
'}]
commit_message:
Six-ify error handling in heat-api* scripts

Allow for proper error propagation on startup in heat-api* scripts
when deployed on Python 2.6.

Change-Id: I63fd8d9cac73604438961966c5e9692a53771a18
Closes-Bug: #1369440
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/73/121473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six sys.exit("ERROR: %s" % six.text_type(e))

commit_message:
Add test to compare security_group_info_for_devices with old rpc

security_group_info_for_devices is replacing the old
security_group_rules_for_devices rpc. The new one doesn't exhibit
exponential result size growth or execution time. This test
is to assert that the result size is small enough.

blueprint security-group-rules-for-devices-rpc-call-refactor

Change-Id: I7cb8f956a6a6c437e1c28ba69016c8083ad63caa

added_lines: import copyselfGlobal = None def get_port_from_device(self, device): device = copy.deepcopy(self.devices.get(device)) def _build_sg_rule_tcp_ingress_remote(self, sg_id, remote_id, start_port=24, end_port=25): rule = self._build_security_group_rule( sg_id, 'ingress', const.PROTO_NAME_TCP, start_port, end_port, remote_group_id=remote_id) rules = { 'security_group_rules': [rule['security_group_rule']]} res = self._create_security_group_rule(self.fmt, rules) self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, webob.exc.HTTPCreated.code) def _create_ports(self, network_id, security_groups, amount): port_list = [] for n in range(amount): port_data = self._create_port( self.fmt, network_id, security_groups=security_groups) port_dict = self.deserialize(self.fmt, port_data) port_list.append(port_dict['port']) return port_list def _delete_ports(self, ports): for port in ports: self._delete('ports', port['id']) def test_sg_info_for_devices_vs_sg_rules_for_devices(self): f = open("/tmp/benchmark_rpc.txt",'w') for n in range(2,40): self._test_sg_info_for_devices_vs_sg_rules_for_devices(n,f) f.close() def _test_sg_info_for_devices_vs_sg_rules_for_devices(self,n_ports,f): with self.network() as n: with contextlib.nested(self.subnet(n), self.security_group()) as (subnet_v4, sg): net_id = n['network']['id'] sg_id = sg['security_group']['id'] self._build_sg_rule_tcp_ingress_remote(sg_id, sg_id) all_ports = self._create_ports(net_id, [sg_id], n_ports) self.rpc.devices = {port['id']:port for port in all_ports} devices = [port['id'] for port in all_ports] ctx = context.get_admin_context() import time new_start = time.time() for i in range(100): new_rpc = self.rpc.security_group_info_for_devices( ctx, devices=devices) new_end = time.time() old_start = time.time() for i in range(100): old_rpc= self.rpc.security_group_rules_for_devices( ctx, devices=devices) old_end = time.time() time_new = (new_end-new_start)/100.0 time_old = (old_end-old_start)/100.0 print "new_rpc=",len(str(new_rpc)), time_new print "old_rpc=",len(str(old_rpc)), time_old self.assertTrue(len(str(new_rpc)) < (len(str(old_rpc)))) self._delete_ports(all_ports) #self.assertTrue(False) f.write("%d, %d, %f, %d, %f\n" % (n_ports, len(str(new_rpc)), time_new, len(str(old_rpc)), time_old)) f.flush() self._build_sg_rule_tcp_ingress_remote(sg1_id, sg2_id, 24, 25) ports_sg1 = self._create_ports(n['network']['id'], [sg1_id], 1) port_id1 = ports_sg1[0]['id'] self.rpc.devices = {port_id1: ports_sg1[0]} ports_sg2 = self._create_ports(n['network']['id'], [sg2_id], 1) port_id2 = ports_sg2[0]['id'] self._delete_ports(ports_sg1 + ports_sg2)
deleted_lines: def get_port_from_device(self, device): device = self.devices.get(device) rule1 = self._build_security_group_rule( sg1_id, 'ingress', const.PROTO_NAME_TCP, '24', '25', remote_group_id=sg2['security_group']['id']) rules = { 'security_group_rules': [rule1['security_group_rule']]} res = self._create_security_group_rule(self.fmt, rules) self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, webob.exc.HTTPCreated.code) res1 = self._create_port( self.fmt, n['network']['id'], security_groups=[sg1_id]) ports_rest1 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res1) port_id1 = ports_rest1['port']['id'] self.rpc.devices = {port_id1: ports_rest1['port']} res2 = self._create_port( self.fmt, n['network']['id'], security_groups=[sg2_id]) ports_rest2 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res2) port_id2 = ports_rest2['port']['id'] self._delete('ports', port_id1) self._delete('ports', port_id2)

commit_message:
Use auth provider in official client manager

WIP - do not merge

Enforce using auth provider in the official client manager
so that the auth API version can be controlled for scenario
tests as well.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: I860a23572bfab58043631e4ff7239deeacb6eff7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/66/90166/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME (andreaf) client built with token have to be refreshed self.client_type = 'official' # get an admin auth provider self.admin_auth_provider = self.get_auth_provider( auth.get_default_credentials('identity_admin')) def _get_token_url(self, service, admin=False): conf_group = getattr(CONF, service) filters = { 'service': conf_group.catalog_type, 'endpoint_type': conf_group.endpoint_type, 'region': conf_group.region, } if admin: token = self.admin_auth_provider.get_token() endpoint = self.admin_auth_provider.base_url(filters) else: token = self.auth_provider.get_token() endpoint = self.auth_provider.base_url(filters) return token, endpoint # FIXME (andreaf) Make nova client consume data from auth_provider token, endpoint = self._get_token_url('image') # FIXME (andreaf) Make volume client consume data from auth_provider token, endpoint = self._get_token_url('object_storage') keystone_admin = self.admin_auth_provider.auth_client return swiftclient.Connection(preauthtoken=token, preauthurl=endpoint) token, endpoint = self._get_token_url('orchestration') return heatclient.client.Client(self.HEATCLIENT_VERSION, endpoint, token=token, username=credentials.username, password=credentials.password) # This identity client is used for identity scenario tests # Thus its version is not bound to auth_version token, endpoint = self._get_token_url('baremetal') api_version, os_auth_token=token, ironic_url=endpoint, insecure=insecure) token, endpoint = self._get_token_url('network', admin=True) token=token, endpoint_url=endpoint, token, endpoint = self._get_token_url('data_processing', admin=True) input_auth_token=token, sahara_url=endpoint)
deleted_lines: # FIXME(andreaf) Auth provider for client_type 'official' is # not implemented yet, setting to 'tempest' for now. self.client_type = 'tempest' token = self.identity_client.auth_token region = CONF.identity.region endpoint_type = CONF.image.endpoint_type endpoint = self.identity_client.service_catalog.url_for( attr='region', filter_value=region, service_type=CONF.image.catalog_type, endpoint_type=endpoint_type) auth_url = CONF.identity.uri admin_credentials = auth.get_default_credentials('identity_admin') keystone_admin = self._get_identity_client(admin_credentials) endpoint_type = CONF.object_storage.endpoint_type os_options = {'endpoint_type': endpoint_type} return swiftclient.Connection(auth_url, credentials.username, credentials.password, tenant_name=credentials.tenant_name, auth_version='2', os_options=os_options) keystone = self._get_identity_client(credentials) region = CONF.identity.region endpoint_type = CONF.orchestration.endpoint_type token = keystone.auth_token service_type = CONF.orchestration.catalog_type try: endpoint = keystone.service_catalog.url_for( attr='region', filter_value=region, service_type=service_type, endpoint_type=endpoint_type) except keystoneclient.exceptions.EndpointNotFound: return None else: return heatclient.client.Client(self.HEATCLIENT_VERSION, endpoint, token=token, username=credentials.username, password=credentials.password) auth_url = CONF.identity.uri service_type = CONF.baremetal.catalog_type endpoint_type = CONF.baremetal.endpoint_type creds = { 'os_username': self.credentials.username, 'os_password': self.credentials.password, 'os_tenant_name': self.credentials.tenant_name } api_version=api_version, os_auth_url=auth_url, insecure=insecure, os_service_type=service_type, os_endpoint_type=endpoint_type, **creds) credentials = auth.get_default_credentials('identity_admin') auth_url = CONF.identity.uri endpoint_type = CONF.network.endpoint_type username=credentials.username, password=credentials.password, tenant_name=credentials.tenant_name, endpoint_type=endpoint_type, auth_url=auth_url, endpoint_type = CONF.data_processing.endpoint_type catalog_type = CONF.data_processing.catalog_type auth_url = CONF.identity.uri credentials.username, credentials.password, project_name=credentials.tenant_name, endpoint_type=endpoint_type, service_type=catalog_type, auth_url=auth_url)

commit_message:
Improve OS::Compute::HostCapabilities description

The OS::Compute::HostCapabilities namespace should include more
information about how the properties are used by Nova.
Let admin's know that the ComputeCapabilitiesFilter needs to
be enabled.

Change-Id: Ib3232e560969462d3973606e138a96d1a5beb7de
Closes-bug: 1367860

The ComputeCapabilitiesFilter should be enabled in the Nova scheduler to use these properties. Only hosts that can provide the requested capabilities will be eligible for hosting the instance.",

commit_message:
Update neutron file permission

File permissions set in network cookbook should be set with 740 or
650 to avoid other users reading the secrete in configuration or
script files

Implements blueprint neutron-configured-files-permission
Change-Id: Id030ef2bc419d19127544876c7874f13aa37b6df

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:54:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/solum-specs/commit/d11fbcf0b2782e8a965c66e373f6252cf8e57c49', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910

commit_message:
Reduce unit test log level for notifications.

The current debug level of notifications causes unit test debug
files to be very large. This patch reduces the default log level
for notifications to INFO. This single change reduces the size
of the debug file by 20Mb (or 38%).

Change-Id: Idede6fd47d74705dd0fd62c009ebf7bba10f82ed
Closes-Bug: 1369180

commit_message:
Fix delete group cleans up role assignments with LDAP

When the LDAP assignment backend was used and a group was deleted,
the role assignments for the group were not getting cleaned up. The
role assignments for the group should have been removed along with the
group.

Change-Id: Ie506659c2b21e6a816335b00642fa4d0921a184d
Closes-Bug: #1366211

commit_message:
Enable QOS Specs to be associated with volume type

New option for volume types which allows a QOS Spec
to be associated/disassociated with the volume type

Completes: blueprint cinder-qos-specs

Change-Id: I232cb7bc8756c3985997413f92e0c195bfa1ca7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/71/113571/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2012 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # All Rights Reserved. # # Copyright 2012 Nebula, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from django.utils.translation import ugettext_lazy as _ from django.views.decorators.debug import sensitive_variables # noqa from horizon import exceptions from horizon import forms from horizon import workflows from openstack_dashboard import api class SetQosSpecChoiceAction(workflows.Action): old_qos_spec_id = forms.CharField(required=False, widget=forms.HiddenInput()) old_qos_spec_name = forms.CharField( label=_("Current Association"), widget=forms.TextInput(attrs={'readonly': 'readonly'}), required=False, ) qos_spec = forms.ChoiceField(label=_("New Association"), help_text=_("Choose the QOS Spec to associate with.")) class Meta: name = _("Select Association") slug = 'association_choice' def clean(self): cleaned_data = super(SetQosSpecChoiceAction, self).clean() qos_spec = cleaned_data.get('qos_spec', None) if qos_spec is None or qos_spec == cleaned_data['old_qos_spec_id']: raise forms.ValidationError(_('Please choose a new QOS Spec that ' 'is not the same as the old one.')) return cleaned_data def populate_qos_spec_choices(self, request, context): qos_specs = context.get('qos_specs') if qos_specs: qos_specs.insert(0, ("", _("Select a New QOS Spec"))) else: qos_specs.insert(0, ("", _("No QOS Specs available"))) return qos_specs class SetQosSpecChoice(workflows.Step): action_class = SetQosSpecChoiceAction depends_on = ("type_id", "name") contributes = ("old_qos_spec_id", "old_qos_spec_name", "qos_specs", "qos_spec") class AssociateQosSpecsWorkFlow(workflows.Workflow): slug = "update_volume_type" name = _("Associate/Disassociate QOS Specs with Volume Type") finalize_button_name = _("Associate") success_message = _('Modified QOS Spec Association for ' 'Volume Type "%s".') failure_message = _('Unable to modify QOS Spec Association ' 'for Volume Type "%s".') success_url = "horizon:admin:volumes:volume_types_tab" default_steps = (SetQosSpecChoice, ) @sensitive_variables('context') def handle(self, request, context): vol_type_id = context.get('type_id') qos_spec_id = context.get('qos_spec') # Update QOS Spec association information try: # NOTE - volume types can only be associated with # ONE QOS Spec at a time # first we need to un-associate the old QOS Spec, if it exists old_qos_spec_id = context.get('old_qos_spec_id') if old_qos_spec_id: qos_spec = api.cinder.qos_spec_get(self.request, old_qos_spec_id, raw=True) api.cinder.qos_spec_disassociate(self.request, qos_spec, vol_type_id) # now associate with new QOS Spec qos_spec = api.cinder.qos_spec_get(self.request, qos_spec_id, raw=True) api.cinder.qos_spec_associate(self.request, qos_spec, vol_type_id) except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _('Error when associating QOS Specs')) return False return True

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2014-09-15 02:10+0000\n" "PO-Revision-Date: 2014-09-14 13:51+0000\n"msgstr "VNC コンソールプロキシー"msgstr "VNC プロキシーは、コンピュートサービスのユーザーが VNC クライアント経由で自身のインスタンスにアクセスできるようにする、OpenStack コンポーネントです。"msgstr "VNC コンソール接続は、以下のとおり動作します。"msgstr "ユーザーは、API に接続し、<literal>http://<replaceable>ip:port</replaceable>/?token=xyz</literal> のような <literal>access_url</literal> を取得します。"msgstr "ユーザーは、URL をブラウザーに貼り付けるか、クライアントパラメーターとして使用します。"msgstr "ブラウザーやクライアントは、プロキシーに接続します。"msgstr "Object Storage のトラブルシューティング"msgstr "ドライブ故障"msgstr "故障したドライブの検知"msgstr "主なレプリケーションの種類は、以下のとおりです。"msgstr "<emphasis role=\"bold\">データベースレプリケーション</emphasis>。コンテナーとオブジェクトをレプリケーションします。"msgstr "<emphasis role=\"bold\">オブジェクトレプリケーション</emphasis>。オブジェクトデータをレプリケーションします。"msgstr "データベースレプリケーション"msgstr "Object Storage 序論"msgstr "Keystone クライアント"msgstr "OpenStack Identity API のコマンドラインインターフェース。例えば、ユーザーは <placeholder-1/> と <placeholder-2/> コマンドを実行して、OpenStack 環境にサービスを登録できます。"msgstr "以下の図は OpenStack Identity の処理の流れを示しています。"msgstr "機能と利点"msgstr "利点"msgstr "コモディティハードウェアのレバレッジ"msgstr "ロックイン排除、より安い GB 単価"msgstr "HDD/ノードの故障の不可知"msgstr "故障からの自己修復、信頼性、データ冗長化の保護"msgstr "無制限のストレージ"msgstr "大規模でフラットな名前空間、大きくスケール可能な読み書きアクセス、ストレージシステムからコンテンツを直接処理可能"msgstr "多次元のスケーラビリティ"

commit_message:
Update keystone file permission

File permissions set in identity cookbook should be set with 740 or
650 to avoid other users reading the secrete in configuration or
script files

Implements blueprint keystone-configured-files-permission
Change-Id: Ie571dcd71c8d1693a679ee073e58d421ab7af7c3

commit_message:
Cherry pick Neutron fix for enable_ipset breakage

This adds a cherry pick for a Neutron enable_ipset default
setting update that recently broke Overcloud deployments.

See the neutron patch here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121434/

Change-Id: Ib88c7601378e83e0352271f7ff7180a75a3fe811

commit_message:
Cherry pick Nova fix for Scheduler TypeError

This adds a cherry pick for a Nova fix that resolves
a TypeError in the Ironic and Nova Baremetal scheduler
host state classes:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121397/1

Also, removes the no-longer needed cherry pick for the
Nova Ironic extra_specs fix which has now landed.

Change-Id: I49a680b1373e16ce2887c97badfbaaa2f4232f69
Related-bug: #1369151

commit_message:
Big Switch: Check for 'id' in port before lookup

Check for the presence of the 'id' key before trying
to do a lookup based on the value. This is necessary
because a 'fields' param to get_port(s) may exclude
the 'id' field before the host_id lookup.

Closes-Bug: #1358668
Change-Id: If30567d5deaeabd2de6c6287fac7a81695a41cc5

commit_message:
Workaround pypy bug on trusty when running tests

https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/issue/1694/ affects zaqar when running
pypy tests on trusty slave nodes. We can work around that bug by setting
--jit off when running the pypy interpreter. Do this until the upstream
bug fix is backported into trusty.

Change-Id: Iebaa167e9e12bbc1017371929ca8c182bacc2aad
Related-Bug: 1368418
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/06/120906/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:pypy] setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} ZAQAR_TESTS_DIR={toxinidir}/tests ZAQAR_TESTS_CONFIGS_DIR={toxinidir}/tests/etc/ JIT_FLAG=--jit off

commit_message:
Skip info cache update in case instance is deleted

The network api is sometimes called for a deleted instance causing
info cache update to fail. An example of this is the compute manager
periodic task cleanup_running_deleted_instances() that tries to
shutdown deleted instances still running on a host.

Add a check in network_api.update_instance_cache_with_nw_info() that
will skip info cache update if the instance is deleted.

Change-Id: Ibcf2db92275c9860409793d469ed688e7024120b
Closes-Bug: #1282858

commit_message:
Support control files

Allow templates to provide a control file (EG foo => foo.oac). The
control file must be a single YAML mapping. Directory control files are
not supported yet.

Provide a single valid key, allow_empty, by way of example. If
allow_empty is false, either the target file will not be created or if
there's already a file in place, it will be deleted.

Add requirement on 'six' library for Python 3.3 compatibility.

Advances blueprint oac-header
See spec I8fe7126d7261c1f106d7413bd31aa379e9ae5c3e

Change-Id: Ic6952688e4f8273885192bcd5eda8cb657f5a940

commit_message:
Update nova.conf permission

contains password properties like:
qpid_password=W0lCTTp2MV1kY3ZxcHl2cmFn
neutron_admin_password=W0lCTTp2MV1iY3JhZmducHgtYXJnamJleA==
To avoid unauthorized user to access it and decode the password, this file will be set as 640

Fix bug 1369411

Change-Id: I67606df38ab7829e29eaec686130fa88514be7d1

commit_message:
neutronclient shows low-level logs in console screen

Neutron command lines always display some useless information. This
should be avoided. This commit modifies the default level of console
stream to WARNING.

Closes-bug: #1356735

Change-Id: I997dad9ce3fc3eb795e4e44b27d211fa619c1907
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/64/114164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The default log level is INFO, in this situation, set the # log level of the console to WARNING, to avoid displaying # useless messages. This equals using "--quiet" if console_level == logging.INFO: console.setLevel(logging.WARNING) else: console.setLevel(console_level)

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:44:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/60e89610974884a37a606e6d2a5936c511a20b18', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/12/121312/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: extensions = ['sphinx.ext.autodoc', 'oslosphinx']
deleted_lines: extensions = ['sphinx.ext.autodoc', 'sphinx.ext.intersphinx', 'oslosphinx'] # Example configuration for intersphinx: refer to the Python standard library. intersphinx_mapping = {'http://docs.python.org/': None}

commit_message:
Add oslo.utils and oslo.serialization

Install the oslo.utils and oslo.serialization libraries from source so
the gate tests run against master.

(This is needed for stable/icehouse to facilitate testing against new
keystoneclient installed via 'git clone' that will depend on oslo.utils.)

Change-Id: I2cb35c9dfd18588e4caa11134e6a34d83324e136
(cherry picked from commit 5cd17f71ca8cf335beeaad55a1b530825bd181c8)

commit_message:
Avoid auto-scheduling for distributed routers

The reason for this is twofold:

- It may relieve contention on DB access while
  both servers and l3 agents are busy setting up
  and syncing routers down respectively.

- It prevents accidental placement of namespaces
  during the L3 sync_routers process, as auto
  scheduling without taking into account the state
  of the L3 agents, as well as the state of the
  routers being processed, may overrule the placement
  decision made during router operations.

Partial-bug: #1356121
Partial-bug: #1359326

Change-Id: Ia677ce212145d6cee65adeb1d8ae594e6ac5e34d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/54/115754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_routers_to_schedule(self, context, plugin, router_ids=None, exclude_distributed=False): if exclude_distributed: unscheduled_routers = [ r for r in unscheduled_routers if not r['distributed'] ] # NOTE(armando-migliaccio): DVR routers should not be auto scheduled # because auto-scheduling may interfere with the placement rules for # IR and SNAT namespaces. context, plugin, router_ids, exclude_distributed=True)
deleted_lines: def get_routers_to_schedule(self, context, plugin, router_ids=None): context, plugin, router_ids) if (router.get('distributed', False) and self.dvr_has_binding(context, router['id'], l3_agent.id)): continue

from outside devstack's directory

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in

commit_message:
Don't clear _mounted_shares list in remoteFS while updating

This fix makes the updating of the _mounted_shares list in
remoteFS more of an atomic operation.  Previously this list
would be cleared, then rebuilt.  That allowed a race
condition where operations that took place during this
update would have a list of 0 shares to work with.

Change-Id: I740d8f1b87db911242326a38ff398b81c5974cea
Closes-Bug: #1366083

commit_message:
ldap/core deleteTree not always supported

Most LDAP servers do not support CONTROL_TREEDELETE
(OID 1.2.840.113556.1.4.805) e.g. openldap, 389, and many others.
The LDAP server will respond with ldap.NOT_ALLOWED_ON_NONLEAF
in that case, and the client will have to fallback on doing an
LDAP search to get the list of entries to delete, then deleting
the entries in order of child to parent, since LDAP forbids the
deletion of a parent entry which has children.  The simplest way
to generate a child to parent ordering is to delete the entries
in the order of the length of the DN, from longest to shortest.

Closes-Bug: #1282355

Change-Id: I3f08cc4bc890eec9f91945941c3636cb0b30658a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/97/74897/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except ldap.NOT_ALLOWED_ON_NONLEAF: # few ldap servers support the tree_delete_control # so have to do a search then delete in reverse order entries = conn.search_s(self._id_to_dn(object_id), ldap.SCOPE_SUBTREE, '(objectclass=*)', ['1.1']) # entries should not be None here - if we did not hit ldap.NO_SUCH_OBJECT, that # means there is an entry which should be returned in entries entries.reverse() for dn, _ in entries: conn.delete_s(dn)

commit_message:
Create an Auth Plugin to pass to users

We pass the service catalog and token data through to consumers via
headers, with the auth plugin work we can create clients that are
authenticated with the incoming token and service catalog.

DocImpact: A new environment option is passed out of auth_token
middleware called `token_auth` which is an authentication plugin that
can be used with a session in a service.

Implements: blueprint create-auth-plugin
Change-Id: I549a421fc73f00126f6ac5f4b5911de2e32de825
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/22/107222/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneclient import session def test_auth_plugin(self): httpretty.register_uri(httpretty.GET, self.examples.SERVICE_URL, body=VERSION_LIST_v3, status_code=300) req = webob.Request.blank('/') req.headers['X-Auth-Token'] = self.token_dict['uuid_token_default'] body = self.middleware(req.environ, self.start_fake_response) self.assertEqual(200, self.response_status) self.assertEqual([FakeApp.SUCCESS], body) token_auth = req.environ['keystone.token_auth'] endpoint_filter = {'service_type': self.examples.SERVICE_TYPE, 'version': 3} url = token_auth.get_endpoint(session.Session(), **endpoint_filter) self.assertEqual('%s/v3' % BASE_URI, url)

Related-bug: #1344581

commit_message:
Change LOG.exception to LOG.info for skipped tests

The safe setup decorator was presenting skipException in the logs as an error
and so producing lot of noise in tempest.log.

Change-Id: Ia95d6b9dee4eaf4fc8de4bb128f958ef7f693844
Related-bug: #1344581
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/120824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if etype is cls.skipException: LOG.info("setUpClass skipped: %s:" % se) else: LOG.exception("setUpClass failed: %s" % se)

subject: Default to /24 prefix for floating IP range with neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 00:06:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/nicira', 'stack.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/4a175c1c071c8b08b0327f80ee6848c80c23d47e', 'message': 'Default to /24 prefix for floating IP range with neutron

When running Tempest parallel tests with neutron, several long-running
tests might create routers and floating IPs, which will result in
IP allocations over the public network.

Increasing the public network size should ensure tests do not fail
due to IP address shortage; this patch also updates the public network
gateway IP address.

Related-Bug: 1253966
Closes-Bug: 1367972

Change-Id: Ie075b3c4d14a07b06c42fd29b09770dd1972aa45
(cherry picked from commit 90234ac4b03426d844b72d251d4cae13fa09cde5)
'}]
commit_message:
Default to /24 prefix for floating IP range with neutron

When running Tempest parallel tests with neutron, several long-running
tests might create routers and floating IPs, which will result in
IP allocations over the public network.

Increasing the public network size should ensure tests do not fail
due to IP address shortage; this patch also updates the public network
gateway IP address.

Related-Bug: 1253966
Closes-Bug: 1367972

Change-Id: Ie075b3c4d14a07b06c42fd29b09770dd1972aa45
(cherry picked from commit 90234ac4b03426d844b72d251d4cae13fa09cde5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/26/120626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FLOATING_RANGE=${FLOATING_RANGE:-172.24.4.0/24}

commit_message:
Add ability to set floating IP Pool names

  - Allows user to create multiple pools outside
    of the 'nova::manage::floating' definition.

commit_message:
Set is_public to False by default for volume backed snapshots

This update results in the same behavior that is already implemented
in _create_image where the meta_data for is_public is set to False.

Change-Id: Ie0720d5c847871527db7d9477ca6cb05abe7a1a5
Closes-Bug: #1255316
(cherry picked from commit 0530e02004578a36039111beddf472fcf3e48df6)

commit_message:
Add RPC API for cancel update stack

Implements cancelling of stack update in progress, for any stack
regardless of disable_rollback status.

As a side-effect, a framework for sending arbitrary one-time signals from
outside into a task running as greenthread is added. ThreadgroupManager
holds references of greenlet events associated with a given stack now.

Implements blueprint cancel-update-stack (partial)

Change-Id: Ic929d42946cf28eeb2a7caea8bf908f492693c09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/51/102851/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.common import param_utils if rpc_api.PARAM_CANCEL in args: cancel = param_utils.extract_bool(args[rpc_api.PARAM_CANCEL]) else: cancel = False if cancel: if current_stack.state == (current_stack.UPDATE, current_stack.IN_PROGRESS): # stop the running update and steal the lock self._stop_and_steal_lock(cnxt, stack_identity, current_stack, self.engine_id) else: msg = _("Cancelling update when stack is %s" ) % current_stack.state raise exception.NotSupported(msg) if cancel: updated_stack = current_stack._backup_stack() else: tmpl = parser.Template(template, files=files) if len(tmpl[tmpl.RESOURCES]) > cfg.CONF.max_resources_per_stack: raise exception.RequestLimitExceeded( message=exception.StackResourceLimitExceeded.msg_fmt) stack_name = current_stack.name common_params = api.extract_args(args) common_params.setdefault(rpc_api.PARAM_TIMEOUT, current_stack.timeout_mins) env = environment.Environment(params) updated_stack = parser.Stack(cnxt, stack_name, tmpl, env, **common_params) updated_stack.parameters.set_stack_id(current_stack.identifier()) self._validate_deferred_auth_context(cnxt, updated_stack) updated_stack.validate() updated_stack, cancel=cancel) def _stop_and_steal_lock(self, cnxt, stack_identity, stack, engine_id): if stack_lock.StackLock.engine_alive(cnxt, engine_id): stop_result = remote_stop(engine_id) if stop_result is None: LOG.debug("Successfully stopped remote task on engine %s" % engine_id) else: raise exception.StopActionFailed(stack_name=stack.name, engine_id=engine_id) @request_context def delete_stack(self, cnxt, stack_identity): """ The delete_stack method deletes a given stack. :param cnxt: RPC context. :param stack_identity: Name of the stack you want to delete. commit_message:
ofagent: Clean up logging

- Use _LI, _LW, _LE
- Remove localization from debug logs
- Replace LOG.debug calls with @log.log decorator where appropriate

Change-Id: I9c80c556003db7b0b8e99da0340a26beb1e00e16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/82/119682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import log from neutron.openstack.common.gettextutils import _LI @log.log def _send_arp_reply(self, datapath, port, pkt): @log.log def _send_unknown_packet(self, msg, in_port, out_port): @log.log def add_arp_table_entry(self, network, ip, mac): @log.log def del_arp_table_entry(self, network, ip): LOG.info(_LI("No bridge is set")) LOG.info(_LI("Unknown bridge %(dpid)s ours %(ours)s"), LOG.info(_LI("packet-in dpid %(dpid)s in_port %(port)s pkt %(pkt)s"), LOG.info(_LI("drop non tenant packet")) LOG.info(_LI("drop non-ethernet packet")) LOG.info(_LI("drop non-arp packet")) LOG.info(_LI("unknown network %s"), network)
deleted_lines: def _send_arp_reply(self, datapath, port, pkt): LOG.debug("packet-out %s", pkt) def _send_unknown_packet(self, msg, in_port, out_port): LOG.debug("unknown packet-out in-port %(in_port)s " "out-port %(out_port)s msg %(msg)s", {'in_port': in_port, 'out_port': out_port, 'msg': msg}) def add_arp_table_entry(self, network, ip, mac): LOG.debug("added arp table entry: " "network %(network)s ip %(ip)s mac %(mac)s", {'network': network, 'ip': ip, 'mac': mac}) def del_arp_table_entry(self, network, ip): LOG.debug("deleted arp table entry: network %(network)s ip %(ip)s", {'network': network, 'ip': ip}) LOG.info(_("No bridge is set")) LOG.info(_("Unknown bridge %(dpid)s ours %(ours)s"), LOG.info(_("packet-in dpid %(dpid)s in_port %(port)s pkt %(pkt)s"), LOG.info(_("drop non tenant packet")) LOG.info(_("drop non-ethernet packet")) LOG.info(_("drop non-arp packet")) LOG.info(_("unknown network %s"), network)

commit_message:
convert the conf value into correct type

If options are set in paste file e.g. api-paste.ini for nova, all
the option values passed into AuthProtocol.conf are string type.
So, we should convert the conf value into correct type.

Change-Id: I0367cd6b54ee49f5db6541840539e7700f241f87
Closes-Bug: #1353315

commit_message:
Ensure a consistent transactional context is used

This change repairs a migration that was using multiple
transactional contexts for a single operation.  Using
a Session implies that operations do not proceed under
"autocommit", so here the autoload operations as well as
migration operations are invoked under a single
connection.  The issue has been exposed due to improvements
in oslo.db which expose SQLite as supporting transactional
DDL.

Change-Id: Ic6673234122e1cf1bc4c05907299bb1938e54a9f
Related-Bug: #1367354

commit_message:
Add delete notification to endpoint grouping

Add delete notification to endpoint grouping so that if a project
or endpoint group is deleted this will automatically force the
deletion of the related project endpoint group association.

Closes-Bug: 1365169
Change-Id: Ic67eaf52ec220bc4ace32a7625af643b3f0818d6

commit_message:
Refactor LDAP backend using context manager for connection

I added context manager support for getting connection in LDAP backend
to replace a large amount try-finally blocks to a simple "with"
statement. So both statements are supported now.

Change-Id: I3e3e29a97e6212177cf755719f404cc24204ea54

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:50:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/fa00e68c28b03454c7a2f091daf281a53128d9df', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/20/121320/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Correct definition of ironic_host_state.consume_from_instance

Commit d273e33b7739ed18d19d9bcdd00e084c5795e8d6 introduced a change to
the definition of host_state.consume_from_instance in
nova/scheduler/host_manager.py -- but did not update
ironic_host_manager.py and thus broke it.

This patch corrects that by introducing the same change to Ironic's host
manager class.

Change-Id: I4c6425464eb8f89ba76e65b407d2d10f5fd12040
Closes-bug: 1369317

commit_message:
Switch to a custom NotImplemented error

Some code in the drivers might actually raise the standard
NotImplemented error, and that would be a bug to skip a test if that was
the case. In that case we want the test to fail.

So let's switch to a custom exception that is used to skip the test if
it's raised.

Change-Id: Ideafee0b1f008ff32724fb98d6a477bd3976104d

commit_message:
Add IPMI pollster

New pollster to get IPMI sensor data and Intel Node Manager data. IPMI sensor
data includes main types, like Current, Temperature, Voltage and Fan. Node
manager data includes system power and thermal information.

Implements bp ipmi-support
DocImpact: Add new ipmi agent and pollsters

Change-Id: I4e21711cfdb050488dd2ddda1ca80504e63eafaa
Signed-off-by: Zhai Edwin <edwin.zhai@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add IPMI support

Adds IPMI engine to get sensor data or system power/thermal information on
IPMI capable node, improves overall efficiency and maximizes overall usage for
data center.

Implements bp ipmi-support

Change-Id: I77c881fdaf39c69cfa990468110dbbfa1f8df8dd
Signed-off-by: Zhai Edwin <edwin.zhai@intel.com>

commit_message:
v2: handle InvalidBDM exceptions from compute API

The compute API _validate_bdm method can raise an
InvalidBDMVolume exception which the nova v2 API
servers extension wasn't handling.

This adds InvalidBDM (the base class for various
invalid BDM exception types) handling in the v2
servers create method.

The v3 API is already handling individual
InvalidBDM exceptions. This change also cleans up
a duplicate exception handled in that code.

Unit tests are added for the v2 and v3 API
extensions for InvalidBDMVolume.

Change-Id: I1f4182e612fbe366fa0733df785ec0f6fcc95196
Closes-Bug: #1368939

commit_message:
Builtin Integrated with Runtime

Added:
Runtime, compile code to
integrate builtins
Tests
Syntax checking for builtins
Ongoing work items:
Ordering and safety checks

Change-Id: I215767b652002aea71fcc7815058ab272dacb0f8

added_lines: import sys from unify import bi_unify_lists sys.path.append("/root/congress8/congress/congress/policy") from builtin.congressbuiltin import CongressBuiltinCategoryMap as cbcmap from builtin.congressbuiltin import start_builtin_map as initbuiltin self.cbcmap = cbcmap(initbuiltin) elif self.cbcmap.check_if_builtin_by_name(lit.tablename(), len(lit.arguments)): cbc = self.cbcmap.return_builtin_pred(lit.tablename()) builtin_code = cbc.code # copy arguments into variables # PLUGGED is an instance of compile.Literal plugged = lit.plug(context.binding) # PLUGGED.arguments is a list of compile.Term num_inputs = cbc.num_inputs # create args for function args = [] if self.cbcmap.builtin_num_outputs(lit.table) > 0: run_inputs = num_inputs - 1 else: run_inputs = num_inputs for i in xrange(0, run_inputs): assert plugged.arguments[i].is_object(), \ ("Builtins must be evaluated only after their " "inputs are ground: {} with num-inputs {}".format( str(plugged), num_inputs)) args.append(plugged.arguments[i].name) # evaluate builtin: must return number, string, or iterable # of numbers/strings result = self.cbcmap.eval_builtin(builtin_code, args) if self.cbcmap.builtin_num_outputs(lit.table) > 0: if isinstance(result, (int, long, float, basestring)): result = [result] # Turn result into normal objects result = [compile.Term.create_from_python(x) for x in result] # adjust binding list unifier = self.new_bi_unifier() undo = bi_unify_lists(result, unifier, lit.arguments[num_inputs - 1:], context.binding) if undo is None: self.print_fail(lit, context.binding, context.depth) return False # otherwise, try to finish proof. If success, return True if self.top_down_finish(context, caller): unify.undo_all(undo) return True # if fail, return False. else: unify.undo_all(undo) self.print_fail(lit, context.binding, context.depth) return False # if no binding, fail if result: if self.top_down_finish(context, caller): return True # if fail, return False. else: self.print_fail(lit, context.binding, context.depth) return False

commit_message:
labs: osbashauto exit on script error

Make osbashout abort if a client-side scripts returns an error; use a
file named error in the status directory to signal the problem and to
store the name of the offending script for use by Windows batch scripts.

Have osbash.sh and the Windows batch scripts exit when an error file
appears.

Change-Id: I6722e75c9c23b99e5ed25b00429026c2e0ff6a12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/04/121404/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! as_root_exec_script "$SCRIPT"; then echo >&2 "Script returned with error, giving up." # Tell host about the error echo "ERROR in $SCRIPT" >> "$STATUS_DIR/error" exit 1 fi

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:46:38.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/c5df1826a6c331fb7ed07bc5260b5c35017b804e', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/15/121315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: 'sphinx.ext.intersphinx', # Example configuration for intersphinx: refer to the Python standard library. intersphinx_mapping = {'http://docs.python.org/': None}
