commit_message:
Widget to expose the metadata catalog from glance

In Juno, Glance is providing a metadata definitions catalog[1][2] where
users can register the available metadata definitions that can be used
on different types of resources (images, artifacts, volumes, flavors,
aggregates, etc). This includes both simple tags and key / value pairs
(properties, specs, etc).

This widget will get the metadata definitions from Glance
and will let the user add the metadata to the resource being edited.
It provides value validation as well as description information
about the metadata.

An implementation for Images is included in this patch. Additional
patches will be made for other resource types.

This patch also removes Edit Image Custom Properties screen as new
widget provides the same functionality. To avoid regressions owner
property is added to Image Detail screen.

********************** TESTING **************************
You can test this code with Glance patches by following
the instructions at the bottom of this etherpad:
Go to: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/j3-glance-patches
*********************************************************

[1] Approved Glance Juno Spec:
https://github.com/openstack/glance-specs/blob/master/specs/juno/metadata-schema-catalog.rst

[2] Glance PTL Juno Feature Overview:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ptriiw1wK8&t=14m27s

Implements: blueprint tagging
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: Santiago Baldassin <santiago.b.baldassin@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Skowron <pawel.skowron@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Wroblewski <szymon.wroblewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bartosz Fic <bartosz.fic@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Heather Whisenhunt <heather.whisenhunt@hp.com>

commit_message:
compute: Add standard constants for hypervisor virt types

Introduce a nova/compute/hvtype.py module to serve a similar
role to nova/compute/vm_mode.py, by providing constants for known
hypervisor virtualization types. This is primarily used as second
component of entries in the 'supported_instances' host state
property. It is not to be confused with the hypervisor driver
types.

Related-bug: #1348623
Change-Id: I553697992b010179e2bbf25fb8c0d471a15e4b3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/109591/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova.compute import hvtype from nova import exception from nova import test class HvTypeTest(test.NoDBTestCase): def test_valid_string(self): self.assertTrue(hvtype.is_valid("vmware")) def test_valid_constant(self): self.assertTrue(hvtype.is_valid(hvtype.QEMU)) def test_valid_bogus(self): self.assertFalse(hvtype.is_valid("acmehypervisor")) def test_canonicalize_none(self): self.assertIsNone(hvtype.canonicalize(None)) def test_canonicalize_case(self): self.assertEqual(hvtype.QEMU, hvtype.canonicalize("QeMu")) def test_canonicalize_invalid(self): self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidHypervisorVirtType, hvtype.canonicalize, "wibble")

commit_message:
Clean up documentation

Switch to manually generated rst files for the API documentation so we
do not expose private parts of the library.

Fix formatting of usage.rst

Convert bullet list to section headers to fix rendering issues and make
the docs more readable.

Fix formatting of docstrings in classes exposed in the docs to eliminate
warnings/errors from Sphinx.

Add history.rst

Change-Id: I6f500775f801558f7c0c29f180b60f83a7150e02

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-01 12:33:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/546c799ec7205a307264966bf83134dbf4f8bba0', 'message': 'Skip SEGMENTATION_ID checking with flat provider network

prints error message and dies.

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-09 10:55:55.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/af9b2516fffdbb492fb0d7b651d221d5fe6e6ecb', 'message': 'Update parameter checking with provider network

devstack checks whether SEGMENTATION_ID is provided or not when it

prints a error message and dies.
On the other hand, devstack also gets an error from "neutron net-create"
command even if it sets SEGMENTATION_ID with flat option.

Closes-Bug: #1362382

commit_message:
Update parameter checking with provider network

Currently, devstack can't deploy OpenStack with flat provider network.

devstack checks whether SEGMENTATION_ID is provided or not when it
deploys openstack with provider network. If it is not provided devstack
prints a error message and dies.
On the other hand, devstack also gets an error from "neutron net-create"
command even if it sets SEGMENTATION_ID with flat option.

In addition to that, because neutron allows partial specs these days,
SEGMENTATION_ID checking should be removed completely.

Also, devstack uses PHYSICAL_NETWORK both as "network name" and "physical
network name" in neutron command. If it is not provided, the command fails
to create network. So devstack should check whether PHYSICAL_NETWORK is
provided.

See also:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/provider-network-partial-specs

Change-Id: I2273e3369c688bbce1a6e39b43635b5548cc2b98
Closes-Bug: #1362382
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/47/118147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$PROVIDER_NETWORK_TYPE" != 'flat' ]]; then die_if_not_set $LINENO SEGMENTATION_ID "A SEGMENTATION_ID is required to use provider networking" fi NET_ID=$(neutron net-create $PHYSICAL_NETWORK --tenant_id $TENANT_ID --provider:network_type $PROVIDER_NETWORK_TYPE --provider:physical_network "$PHYSICAL_NETWORK" ${SEGMENTATION_ID:+--provider:segmentation_id $SEGMENTATION_ID} --shared | grep ' id ' | get_field 2)
deleted_lines: die_if_not_set $LINENO SEGMENTATION_ID "A SEGMENTATION_ID is required to use provider networking" NET_ID=$(neutron net-create $PHYSICAL_NETWORK --tenant_id $TENANT_ID --provider:network_type $PROVIDER_NETWORK_TYPE --provider:physical_network "$PHYSICAL_NETWORK" --provider:segmentation_id "$SEGMENTATION_ID" --shared | grep ' id ' | get_field 2)

commit_message:
Handle session timeout in the VMware store

The current implementation can lead to session timeouts. This
will occur when accessing the datastore directly through HTTP.
This patch provides a retry mechanism by recreating the session
when getting a 401 status code.

This patch backports Change I54cc9e30c9bc374a2cf82dec4beb9b06594835f8

Change-Id: I245d10c66082215010109e661e799293caec6191

commit_message:
Replace screen_it() with run_process() throughout

run_process will use screen if USE_SCREEN=True (the default),
otherwise it will simply start the requested service. Therefore
wherever screen_it used, run_process can be instead.

Where stop_screen was found it has been replaced with stop_process.

A tail_log function has been added which will tail a logfile in a
screen if USE_SCREEN is True.

lib/template has been updated to reflect the use of the new
functions.

When using sg the quoting in run_process gets very complicated.
To get around this run_process and the functions it calls accepts
an optional third argument. If set it is a group to be used with sg.

Change-Id: Ia3843818014f7c6c7526ef3aa9676bbddb8a85ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/77/120077/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check to see if we are already running DevStack # Note that this is meaningless if USE_SCREEN=False was set in previous runs if type -p screen >/dev/null && screen -ls | egrep -q "[0-9].$SCREEN_NAME"; then echo "You are already running a stack.sh session." echo "To rejoin this session type 'screen -x stack'." echo "To destroy this session, type './unstack.sh'." exit 1 fi run_process zeromq "$OSLO_BIN_DIR/oslo-messaging-zmq-receiver" run_process baremetal "nova-baremetal-deploy-helper"

commit_message:
Adds pipeline hints to the example paste config

The order of entries in the pipeline matters. The is especially true for
the application. It must always come last. None of the configuration
documentation for extensions calls this out when they tell the user to
add something to their pipeline.

Change-Id: I46b9b1ac59865d996caa4174867bcf54318035a3
Closes-Bug: #1363932

It cannot be a filter.# The last item in this pipeline must be service_v3 or an equivalent # application. It cannot be a filter.

commit_message:

commit_message:
VMware: add tests for image fetch/cache functions

Adds unit tests for the vmops image fetch/prepare/cache functions.
No existing tests are modified.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Change-Id: I913c7f5ecfec586ff79e2bc7ab1969a8824476b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/119696/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

self.expected_ds_path_str def _make_vm_config_info(self, is_iso=False, is_sparse_disk=False): disk_type = (constants.DISK_TYPE_SPARSE if is_sparse_disk else constants.DEFAULT_DISK_TYPE) file_type = tmp_image_ds_loc.parent, DsPathMatcher('[fake_ds] vmware_base/%s' % self._image_id)) @mock.patch.object(ds_util, 'file_move') @mock.patch.object(vm_util, 'copy_virtual_disk') @mock.patch.object(vmops.VMwareVMOps, '_delete_datastore_file') def test_cache_sparse_image(self, mock_delete_datastore_file, mock_copy_virtual_disk, mock_file_move): vi = commit_message:
Add nova scenarios to rally-neutron.yaml

rally-neutron.yaml should contains more scenarios for better verification of neutron.

Related-Bug: #1353622

Change-Id: I2d3c7c94cccc5fda83cc242fd69265a5f6a48b9b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-21 12:20:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/edbb40b977d507fc60e816ff7cf3050c2d68cd8c', 'message': 'Sahara EDP context

This context will be used to setup Sahara EDP resources before executing
the Job.

The context will set up:
* Data Sources for the input and the output
* Job Binaries to run a job from
* Jobs to configure the launch args

commit_message:
Sahara Cluster and EDP contexts

These contexts will be used to setup Sahara EDP resources before executing
the Job.

The Cluster context will launch a cluster for each tenant.

The EDP context will set up:
* Data Sources for the input and the output
* Job Binaries to run a job from

Note: A refactoring is done to move Sahara contexts under a separate
module.
Note: The contexts do not start any executions.

Change-Id: I8a7420fcc5fc06eaf70a3f1ad4f573a2811ce303
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/62/115962/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014: Mirantis Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from rally.benchmark.context import base from rally.benchmark.context.cleanup import utils as cleanup_utils from rally.benchmark.scenarios import base as scenarios_base from rally.openstack.common import log as logging from rally import osclients from rally import utils as rutils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class SaharaEDP(base.Context): """Context class for setting up the environment before an EDP job is started. """ __ctx_name__ = "sahara_edp" __ctx_order__ = 414 __ctx_hidden__ = False CONFIG_SCHEMA = { "type": "object", "$schema": rutils.JSON_SCHEMA, "properties": { "input_type": { "type": "string", "oneOf": ["swift", "hdfs"], }, "input_url": { "type": "string", }, "output_type": { "type": "string", "oneOf": ["swift", "hdfs"], }, "output_url": { "type": "string", }, }, "additionalProperties": False, "required": ["input_type", "input_url", "output_type", "output_url"] } def __init__(self, context): super(SaharaEDP, self).__init__(context) self.context["sahara_inputs"] = {} self.context["sahara_outputs"] = {} self.context["sahara_job_binaries"] = {} self.context["sahara_jobs"] = {} @rutils.log_task_wrapper(LOG.info, _("Enter context: `Sahara EDP`")) def setup(self): input_type = self.config["input_type"] input_url = self.config["input_url"] output_type = self.config["output_type"] output_url = self.config["output_url"] ready_tenants = set([]) for user in self.context.get("users", []): tenant_id = user["tenant_id"] if tenant_id not in ready_tenants: ready_tenants.add(tenant_id) clients = osclients.Clients(user["endpoint"]) sahara = clients.sahara() self.setupInputs(sahara, tenant_id, input_type, input_url) self.setupOutputs(sahara, tenant_id, output_type, output_url) def setupInputs(self, sahara, tenant_id, input_type, input_url): #Todo(nkonovalov): Add swift credentials parameters and data upload input_ds = sahara.data_sources.create( name=scenarios_base.Scenario._generate_random_name(prefix="in_"), description="", data_source_type=input_type, url=input_url) self.context["sahara_inputs"][tenant_id] = input_ds.id def setupOutputs(self, sahara, tenant_id, output_type, output_url): #Todo(nkonovalov): Add swift credentials parameters and data upload output_ds = sahara.data_sources.create( name=scenarios_base.Scenario._generate_random_name(prefix="out_"), description="", data_source_type=output_type, url=output_url) self.context["sahara_outputs"][tenant_id] = output_ds.id @rutils.log_task_wrapper(LOG.info, _("Exit context: `Sahara EDP`")) def cleanup(self): clean_tenants = set([]) for user in self.context.get("users", []): tenant_id = user["tenant_id"] if tenant_id not in clean_tenants: clean_tenants.add(tenant_id) sahara = osclients.Clients(user["endpoint"]).sahara() cleanup_utils.delete_job_executions(sahara) cleanup_utils.delete_jobs(sahara) cleanup_utils.delete_job_binaries(sahara) cleanup_utils.delete_data_sources(sahara)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-02 13:39:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/software_config/software_deployment.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c1c48e201afa07935c3af92c845ffc517719297b', 'message': 'Support multiple heatclient versions for SD

The software_deployment resources lazy loads data via the
heatclient _get() function. Not only is this function private
but the oslo-incubator recently reverted things such that
get() should once again be used for lazy loading details.

See oslo-incubator commit 04a1abe59ac39890f57d2eed57d3d1b12bb5d757

This was merged into heatclient master in:

72017c566850da589f7dc7dc275871986aadbd54

This patch makes it so that heat will work with both versions
of heatclient.

Change-Id: I1799636d39cea410b55ffe72eeecba4f4a7a0f80
Closes-bug: #1308770
(cherry picked from commit a7d782395084c6c16304f17d14b824028c5ba450)

commit_message:
Support multiple heatclient versions for SD

The software_deployment resources lazy loads data via the
heatclient _get() function. Not only is this function private
but the oslo-incubator recently reverted things such that
get() should once again be used for lazy loading details.

See oslo-incubator commit 04a1abe59ac39890f57d2eed57d3d1b12bb5d757

This was merged into heatclient master in:

72017c566850da589f7dc7dc275871986aadbd54

This patch makes it so that heat will work with both versions
of heatclient.

Change-Id: I1799636d39cea410b55ffe72eeecba4f4a7a0f80
Closes-bug: #1308770
(cherry picked from commit a7d782395084c6c16304f17d14b824028c5ba450)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/36/118336/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(dprince): when lazy loading the sd attributes # we need to support multiple versions of heatclient if hasattr(sd, 'get'): sd.get() else: sd._get()

commit_message:
VMware: Implement backup/restore for VMDK driver

Currently, backup-create and backup-restore operations are not
supported for volumes created by the VMDK driver. This change
implements backup_volume and restore_backup APIs for VMDK driver.

DocImpact
    Added a new config option 'vmware_tmp_dir' which specifies
    the directory in Cinder host to use for storing temporary
    virtual disk files during backup/restore.

Implements: blueprint vmdk-backup
Change-Id: Ib19a699f71701c2034e77b8e6b50a8a3295a542b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 09:30:40.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/designate'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/6a8a488eb1bbf0bcee24d4679d8df90a8b9704f1', 'message': 'Fix warnings made by keystone_authtoken

auth_* config is deprecated in keystone_authtoken. This change
fixes the log "Configuring admin URI using auth fragments. This
is deprecated, use 'identity_uri' instead." in the gate logs.

The patch also configures auth_uri because keystone_authtoken now
requires it to be set (see the gate log "Configuring auth_uri to point to the

Change-Id: I5e067a3e4900e7eb5e0a1230532834e43538145a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix warnings made by keystone_authtoken

auth_* config is deprecated in keystone_authtoken. This change
fixes the log "Configuring admin URI using auth fragments. This
is deprecated, use 'identity_uri' instead." in the gate logs.

The patch also configures auth_uri because keystone_authtoken now
requires it to be set (see the gate log "Configuring auth_uri to point to the
public identity endpoint is required; clients may not be able to
authenticate against an admin endpoint")

Change-Id: I5e067a3e4900e7eb5e0a1230532834e43538145a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/33/120733/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF keystone_authtoken identity_uri $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI configure_API_version $DESIGNATE_CONF $IDENTITY_API_VERSION
deleted_lines: iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF keystone_authtoken auth_host $KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF keystone_authtoken auth_port $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF keystone_authtoken auth_protocol $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PROTOCOL

commit_message:
Use id attribute map for read-only LDAP

For read-only LDAP, we have no control over the DIT. We can only use the
attribute maps. Therefore, we need to honor the attribute map for all
attributes.

This patch also added the missing ID attribute when creating an object in
LDAP. For lookup, we also need the ID attribute to be returned.

Change-Id: I57c099eefdca7e756d294c35cf5b70d119c5c955
closes-bug: #1361306
closes-bug: #1340041
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/58/117658/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import types if not (self.allow_create and self.allow_delete and self.allow_delete): # NOTE(gyee): for read-only LDAP, we have no control over the # DIT. We can only use the attribute maps. Therefore, we need to # honor the attribute map for all attributes. id = lower_res[self.id_attr.lower()] if isinstance(id, types.ListType): # NOTE(gyee): if this is a multi-value attribute and it has # multiple values, we can't use it as ID. if len(id) != 1: raise exception.Conflict( type=self.id_attr, details=_('Multi-value attribute cannot be used' 'used as ID: %s ') % id) else: id = id[0] obj = self.model(id=id) else: # not read-only LDAP. Retain the dn_to_id behavior so it is # consistent with other writeable LDAP design. obj = self.model(id=self._dn_to_id(res[0]))

that multiple header values might be returned.

commit_message:
HAProxy stats listener must be set to HTTP mode

The HAProxy configurations defaults section includes "mode tcp", which
results in the stats listener inheriting tcp mode. HAProxy requires
this listener to be set to HTTP mode.

Change-Id: I7e39d5973c3a02f4c66b4758dfd3fb363ac11340

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-09 22:08:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/585f9a1c9e3a87739d4c03643b3f42b586f291f4', 'message': "don't disable usb_tablet if spice agent is enabled

It's not really clear why the usb_tablet, which is a user configurable
field, would be masked by the spice agent being enabled. There are
user bugs about this configuration not providing the usb tablet

We should either change the behavior, or explain why this isn't a

the information forward.

Closes-Bug: #1356633
'}]
commit_message:
document why we disable usb_tablet in code

This provides a code level explanation for why we disregard the user
option for use_usb_tablet when the spice agent is enabled. It came up
in a bug report, and having the comment close to the code helps carry
the information forward.

Change-Id: I7945e921b6283519d91e234584d99d9e82218e6d
Closes-Bug: #1356633

Allow for inclusion of authors and changelog when building docs

When git is available and changelog and author building has not
been turned off try to build these two files so that they can be
included in any subsequent documentation.

Use oslo_debug_helper and remove our own version

With the latest version of oslotest, we can now take advantage
of a common oslo_debug_helper script.
We can now remove our own homebrewed version, minor changes to
tox.ini were needed.

commit_message:
Allow new quota types

On Nova commit Ib281e43eabfbd176454bde7f0622d46fb04fcb79, we are adding
two new new quota values for server groups.

However, current Tempest rejects unexpected quota values on its own tests,
and we cannot add the new quota without Tempest changes.

This patch changes quota tests for checking mandatory quota existence
and allowing new quota types.   It also avoids truing to restore the
new quota values for now, until we have client support for them.

Tempest commit I4409a7240dc0a3fa1e11c64c5f5a56ca656b70a4 has already made
the same change for the non admin tests

Change-Id: I618137ea3e8d3d1259c31a2d579c6b752db321e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/95/120395/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for quota in expected_quota_set: self.assertIn(quota, quota_set.keys()) # NOTE The following is safe as we're not updating these two quota # values yet. Once the Nova change to add these is merged and the # client updated to support them this can be removed if 'server_groups' in default_quota_set: default_quota_set.pop('server_groups') if 'server_group_members' in default_quota_set: default_quota_set.pop('server_group_members') for quota in new_quota_set: self.assertIn(quota, quota_set.keys())

commit_message:
[Hbase] Add column for source filter in _get_meter_samples

Earlier column for source was not created and "get_samples"
method with source query worked incorrect. In this change
it is fixed.

Fixes: bug #1330989

Change-Id: Ie8be408d6b54471322e2f585ddf27c50219b8fd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/58/100558/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix v2 requests to non-bleeding edge servers

In the case where v2 requests are sent to a server which is not running
head of tree which includes the v2 metadef code some 404 cases need to
be handled to enable standard requests to complete.

This patch aslo improves fetching schemas -- they are now only
fetched as needed.

Change-Id: I8c871f11b909337bd7df19b77e606772dbc634b2
Closes-bug: #1367326

commit_message:
Add documentation for implemented identity meters

Add a list of Identity events they can be metered, specifically:

- user authentication
- project create/update/delete
- role create/update/delete
- user create/update/delete
- group create/update/delete
- trust create/delete

Change-Id: I7a2f25c9e5b64e8f3a2ff986660e5ed531d955c3

subject: Strengthens the regex for mongodb json functions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 18:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/mongodb/service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/f193a9da0532bcc900b67f0700a5efa467822651', 'message': 'Strengthens the regex for mongodb json functions

Encloses function args in quotes. abc: Foo(foo, bar)
changes to abc : "foo, bar". Intent is to prevent
mongodb json peculiarities from preventing parsing
of the json

Change-Id: Iafd81cf74908078155344ef4746632d48c460f6a
Closes-Bug: #1368373
'}]
commit_message:
Strengthens the regex for mongodb json functions

Encloses function args in quotes. abc: Foo(foo, bar)
changes to abc : "foo, bar". Intent is to prevent
mongodb json peculiarities from preventing parsing
of the json

Change-Id: Iafd81cf74908078155344ef4746632d48c460f6a
Closes-Bug: #1368373
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/77/120877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Sync service.py and its dependencies to Cinder

Bug 1362455 made note that our sevice.py was out of sync
from what is currently in oslo-incubator.  We have been syncing
things piece meal.  It would be good to get this code synced up.

----------------------------------------------

commit_message:
Subnets with prefix length 0 are invalid

This patch changes the API behaviour to return a 400 error
when a subnet with /0 prefix length is specified.

This kind of subnet hardly make any sense, and also cannot
possibly work when DHCP is enabled.

Change-Id: I8f822f14b91475dcf86ea44ee607013e61cbb6f7
Closes-Bug: #1362651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/117632/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for cidr in new_subnet_ipset.iter_cidrs(): if cidr.prefixlen == 0: err_msg = ("0 is an invalid CIDR prefix length") raise n_exc.InvalidInput(error_message=err_msg)

commit_message:
Bump up taskflow to its newest version

Taskflow 0.4 was just released so update the bounds
to be the version that is most useful for the juno
release.

Release notes @

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/TaskFlow-0.4

Change-Id: Ib261d3d3defdb0fa396b0cef16b322bcce00c64d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/85/119985/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use oslo_debug_helper and remove our own version

With the latest version of oslotest, we can now take advantage
of a common oslo_debug_helper script.
We can now remove our own homebrewed version, minor changes to
tox.ini were needed.

Change-Id: Ide72fb3531f0498dfe289d028049cd432aa08887
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/22/119422/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = oslo_debug_helper.sh {posargs}

Change-Id: Ie4bb075310a61a0873c9e56e4974600dbb4794a1

commit_message:
Allow setting the number of workers to be used.

Environments with large numbers of CPUs will create a large
number of workers which can have an unnecessarily large
impact on memory usage, particular where you know how many
workers are needed.

Change-Id: Ie4bb075310a61a0873c9e56e4974600dbb4794a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/17/117517/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ${TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY:-0} -ne 0 ]]; then MAX_WORKERS=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY fi

commit_message:
Verify alarm found before modifying

Current behavior is to retrieve alarm by id and conduct operations on the
object.  If the tenant doesn't own the alarm or isn't admin, the user will
receive the message: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'to_dict'

Above message doesn't provide any useful diagnostic information and indicates a
programming error since an unexpected None-type is encountered and not handled.

This change verifies the alarm is found before using the object.  If alarm not
found it prints the same message for a not found Alarm as other PUT operations
like alarm-state-set:  Alarm not found: <alarm_id>.

This message is more useful for diagnosis and gets rid of the uncaught
None-type error.

Change-Id: I66abcd4498b24ac7cadcf29fe3ced3fcda08458c
Closes-Bug: #1348387

added_lines: alarm = self.get(alarm_id) if alarm is None: raise exc.CommandError('Alarm not found: %s' % alarm_id) updated = alarm.to_dict()

commit_message:
Let oslotest manage the six.move setting for mox

This instruction to set up a move in six for the mox module conflicts
with the one in oslotest. We are trying to use mox3 everywhere, so
remove this instruction and let oslotest handle it.
Imported from the incubator change with the same ID.

Change-Id: I59d5799283233f8411044ddb15c8abfc8850014c

commit_message:
Remove usage of $[ for arithmetic

$[ is deprecated for the more familiar $((

Required when bash8 starts testing from tox and [1] goes in

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/117430/

subject: Clarify logging in lockutils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 23:05:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cad742d9525cb4d0a630d4ca4c15037ea29e811e', 'message': 'Clarify logging in lockutils

The old logging statements in lockutils made for some confusing log
entries where it would appear a given lock was acquired multiple
times by different threads at the same time.  See referenced bug
for details.

In order to alleviate that confusion, this change does a few things:
1) Adds an explicit "acquired" message inside the lock so it is
   clear when the lock was actually acquired.
2) Moves the release message inside the semaphore so there's no
   chance of it being logged out of order.
3) Removes the "Got semaphore" message and splits it into two
   separate messages depending on whether the semaphore was found
   in the weakref dictionary.  Making it clear which code path
   was followed should help with future debugging.

This is the Nova port of oslo-incubator change
If863c9d3896bc786f3c9c46196ebb0766e57d863

Change-Id: I530befb42a963a40e7d5bf8d4d81fc097e1cb309
Partial-Bug: #1367941
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify logging in lockutils

The old logging statements in lockutils made for some confusing log
entries where it would appear a given lock was acquired multiple
times by different threads at the same time.  See referenced bug
for details.

In order to alleviate that confusion, this change does a few things:
1) Adds an explicit "acquired" message inside the lock so it is
   clear when the lock was actually acquired.
2) Moves the release message inside the semaphore so there's no
   chance of it being logged out of order.
3) Removes the "Got semaphore" message and splits it into two
   separate messages depending on whether the semaphore was found
   in the weakref dictionary.  Making it clear which code path
   was followed should help with future debugging.

This is the Nova port of oslo-incubator change
If863c9d3896bc786f3c9c46196ebb0766e57d863

Change-Id: I530befb42a963a40e7d5bf8d4d81fc097e1cb309

commit_message:
Navigation causes undefined error when clicked on twice

Using the jquery find function on a regular element causes this error. To
resolve this issue, we have to wrap it as a jquery element.

Change-Id: Ibe7dbbdb98c302ca55a30f5205464c469e7d719f
Closes-Bug: #1361315

commit_message:
Updates Example Manifest

The existing example manifest does not work. This patch updates
the example manifest so users can easily deploy Heat using Puppet.

Change-Id: I5b6f19760a7b629e0151f895ab4532af804a8af0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/21/114321/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set Neutron workers according CPU count

In order to improve scalability of neutron-server and
neutron-metadata-agent we need to spawn multiple processes. This patch
changes default of api, rpc and metadata workers according to processors
count on physical machine.

Change-Id: I0480f1652b181e50a8c10230c293d6dfdec3a670
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/32/121132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The default, count of machine's processors, runs the worker thread in the # current process.# Defaults to: $::processorcount# The default, count of machine's processors, runs the worker thread in the # current process.# Defaults to: $::processorcount $api_workers = $::processorcount, $rpc_workers = $::processorcount,
deleted_lines: # The default, 0, runs the worker thread in the current process.# Defaults to: 0# The default, 0, runs the worker thread in the current process.# Defaults to: 0 $api_workers = '0', $rpc_workers = '0',

commit_message:
Only delete stack user project from correct domain

Check the domain ID for the project matches the configured domain from
heat.conf, so we avoid the bad outcome of deleting the user's project
when heat has been configured for stack domain users after creating
some stacks.

Change-Id: I247e732033f44daf0de5b0efeff6c263814d13ab
Closes-Bug: #1365332

commit_message:
Support SR-IOV networking in libvirt

This patch takes care of changing the libvirt modules in support of SR-IOV
networking. Added full support in configuring the two VIF types:
VIF_TYPE_802QBH and VIF_TYPE_HW_VEB and in generating the corresponding
domain XML. It also adds support of attaching/detaching SR-IOV ports
on instance suspend/snapshot/resume operations.

Change-Id: Ibc47d13f47fa0b41cefc27bfff942cdbba6eb399
Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/107466/35 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

self.test_instance) network_info = _fake_network_info(self.stubs, 1) network_info[0]['vnic_type'] = network_model.VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT domain = FakeVirtDomain() conn = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(domain, 'attachDevice') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(domain, 'ID') from nova.compute import utils as compute_utils self.mox.StubOutWithMock(compute_utils, 'get_image_metadata') compute_utils.get_image_metadata(self.context, conn._image_api, instance['image_ref'], instance) domain.ID().AndReturn(1) domain.attachDevice(mock.ANY) self.mox.ReplayAll() conn._attach_sriov_ports(self.context, instance, domain, network_info) def test_attach_sriov_ports_with_info_cache(self): instance = db.instance_create(self.context, self.test_instance) network_info = _fake_network_info(self.stubs, 1) network_info[0]['vnic_type'] = network_model.VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT instance.info_cache.network_info = network_info domain = FakeVirtDomain() conn = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(domain, 'attachDevice') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(domain, 'ID') from nova.compute import utils as compute_utils self.mox.StubOutWithMock(compute_utils, 'get_image_metadata') compute_utils.get_image_metadata(self.context, conn._image_api, instance['image_ref'], instance) domain.ID().AndReturn(1) domain.attachDevice(mock.ANY) self.mox.ReplayAll() conn._attach_sriov_ports(self.context, instance, domain, None) def test_detach_sriov_ports(self): instance = db.instance_create(self.context, self.test_instance) network_info = _fake_network_info(self.stubs, 1) network_info[0]['vnic_type'] = network_model.VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT instance.info_cache.network_info = network_info domain = FakeVirtDomain() conn = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(conn, '_has_min_version') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(domain, 'detachDeviceFlags') from nova.compute import utils as compute_utils self.mox.StubOutWithMock(compute_utils, 'get_image_metadata') compute_utils.get_image_metadata(mock.ANY, conn._image_api, instance['image_ref'], instance) conn._has_min_version(mox.IgnoreArg()).AndReturn(True) domain.detachDeviceFlags(mock.ANY, libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_AFFECT_LIVE) self.mox.ReplayAll() conn._detach_sriov_ports(instance, domain)

subject: Support SR-IOV networking in nova compute api and nova neutronv2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-09 16:24:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/193835ab58785b0d4cb7210b29105950c7579d47', 'message': "Support SR-IOV networking in nova compute api and nova neutronv2

Add another member into the requested_network tuple, and the resulting tuple is <net-id, v4-feixed-ip, port-id, pci-request-id>. For a SR-IOV port, Create a PCI request and add the pci-request-id into the tuple. For a non SR-IOV port, the pci-request-id is None.

Add new fields 'profile' and 'vnic_type' in VIF.

Enhance nova neutronv2 api module to:
  -- retrieve a port's vnic-type and the physical network it is attached to
  -- populate binding:profile before updating a neutron port
  -- populate VIF with newly added fields.

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

Change-Id: I4aab1cd43960d5b1b54a67a05c191f295dfc46fb

PCI request and add the pci-request-id into the tuple. For a non SR-IOV port,
the pci-request-id is None.

Add new fields 'profile' and 'vnic_type' in VIF.

Enhance nova neutronv2 api module to:
  -- retrieve a port's vnic-type and the physical network it is attached to
  -- populate binding:profile before updating a neutron port
  -- populate VIF with newly added fields.

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

Change-Id: I4aab1cd43960d5b1b54a67a05c191f295dfc46fb

"}, {'number': 33, 'created': '2014-08-12 16:55:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/19f63e8ebae1f5e03a6837660370abf91cd9ac90', 'message': "Support SR-IOV networking in nova compute api and nova neutronv2

Add another member into the requested_network tuple, and the resulting tuple is
<net-id, v4-fixed-ip, port-id, pci-request-id>. For a SR-IOV port, Create a
PCI request and add the pci-request-id into the tuple. For a non SR-IOV port,
the pci-request-id is None.
Add new fields 'profile' and 'vnic_type' in VIF.
Enhance nova neutronv2 api module to:
  -- retrieve a port's vnic-type and the physical network it is attached to
  -- populate binding:profile before updating a neutron port
  -- populate VIF with newly added fields.

Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

commit_message:
Support SR-IOV networking in nova compute api and nova neutronv2

Add another field into the NetworkRequest object for the request_id.
For a SR-IOV port, Create a PCI request and add the pci-request-id into
the tuple. For a non SR-IOV port, the pci-request-id is None.
Add new fields 'profile' and 'vnic_type' in VIF.
Enhance nova neutronv2 api module to:
  -- retrieve a port's vnic-type and the physical network it is attached to
  -- populate binding:profile before updating a neutron port
  -- populate VIF with newly added fields.
Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
Change-Id: I4aab1cd43960d5b1b54a67a05c191f295dfc46fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/98828/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.pci import pci_request def test_create_pci_requests_for_sriov_port(self): def fake_is_neutron(): return True self.stubs.Set(utils, 'is_neutron', fake_is_neutron) requested_networks = [(None, None, "port1"), ("net1", None, None), (None, None, "port2"), (None, None, "port3"), (None, None, "port4"), ] self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.compute_api.network_api, "get_port_vnic_info") self.mox.StubOutWithMock(pci_request, "create_pci_request") self.compute_api.network_api.get_port_vnic_info(mox.IgnoreArg(), "port1").AndReturn((network_model.VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT, 'phynet1')) self.compute_api.network_api.get_port_vnic_info(mox.IgnoreArg(), "port2").AndReturn((network_model.VNIC_TYPE_NORMAL, '')) self.compute_api.network_api.get_port_vnic_info(mox.IgnoreArg(), "port3").AndReturn((network_model.VNIC_TYPE_MACVTAP, 'phynet1')) self.compute_api.network_api.get_port_vnic_info(mox.IgnoreArg(), "port4").AndReturn((network_model.VNIC_TYPE_MACVTAP, 'phynet2')) pci_request.create_pci_request(mox.IgnoreArg(), [{pci_request.PCI_NET_TAG: 'phynet1'}]).AndReturn("first") pci_request.create_pci_request(mox.IgnoreArg(), [{pci_request.PCI_NET_TAG: 'phynet1'}]).AndReturn("second") pci_request.create_pci_request(mox.IgnoreArg(), [{pci_request.PCI_NET_TAG: 'phynet2'}]).AndReturn("third") self.mox.ReplayAll() self.compute_api._create_pci_requests_for_sriov_port( None, None, requested_networks) expected_results = [(None, None, "port1", "first"), ("net1", None, None, None), (None, None, "port2", None), (None, None, "port3", "second"), (None, None, "port4", "third"), ] self.assertEqual(expected_results, requested_networks)

subject: Support SR-IOV networking in the PCI modules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-15 17:44:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/286bd5b32920e924f5691875bbc437aae013e96a', 'message': 'Support SR-IOV networking in the PCI modules.

This patch takes care of changing the PCI modules in support of SR-IOV
networking

Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

Change-Id: I9da7bd921f098c958d6fb711a4d03a76862e95c7

'}, {'number': 39, 'created': '2014-08-13 23:21:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/314fdaa72a245306b569945ef46e6588381f41e0', 'message': 'Support SR-IOV networking in the PCI modules

This patch takes care of changing the PCI modules in support of SR-IOV
networking:
  -- Added request_id in the PciDevice object and the corresponding
     model. Migration script is added accordingly.
  -- Added routines to create PCI requests with request id and add
     them to existing requests
  -- Updated pci_whitelist to use devspec that is introduced in this
     patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99043/
  -- stats pool is enhanced so that keys always include product_id and
     vendor_id, and pools are ordered based on the number of
     keys of the pool.

Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
Change-Id: I9da7bd921f098c958d6fb711a4d03a76862e95c7

networking:
  -- Added request_id in the PciDevice object and the corresponding

'}, {'number': 44, 'created': '2014-08-17 03:49:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2e363bfd6a638035072e63e4a299c80e4464ef60', 'message': 'Support SR-IOV networking in the PCI modules

This patch takes care of changing the PCI modules in support of SR-IOV
networking:
  -- Updated pci_whitelist to use devspec that is introduced in this
     patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99043/
  -- For stats pool, to keep the existing behavior, pool keys always
     include product_id and vendor_id. Meanwhile, to work with tags
     and support pci requests based on tags, pools are ordered based
     on the number of keys of the pool. This makes sure that legacy
     pci requests will be satisfied with the pools in the beginning,
     possiblly with devices that are not tagged.

Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
Change-Id: I9da7bd921f098c958d6fb711a4d03a76862e95c7

networking:
  -- Updated pci_whitelist to use devspec that is introduced in this
     patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99043/
  -- For stats pool, to keep the existing behavior, pool keys always
     include product_id and vendor_id. Meanwhile, to work with tags
     and support pci requests based on tags, pools are ordered based
     on the number of keys of the pool. This makes sure that legacy
     pci requests will be satisfied with the pools in the beginning,
     possiblly with devices that are not tagged.

Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
Change-Id: I9da7bd921f098c958d6fb711a4d03a76862e95c7

  -- Updated pci_whitelist to use devspec that is introduced in this
     patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99043/
  -- For stats pool, to keep the existing behavior, pool keys always
     include product_id and vendor_id. Meanwhile, to work with tags
     and support pci requests based on tags, pools are ordered based
     on the number of keys of the pool. This makes sure that legacy
     pci requests will be satisfied with the pools in the beginning,
     possiblly with devices that are not tagged.

commit_message:
Support SR-IOV networking in the PCI modules

This patch takes care of changing the PCI modules in support of SR-IOV
networking:
  -- Updated pci_whitelist to use devspec that is introduced in this
     patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99043/
  -- For stats pool, to keep the existing behavior, pool keys always
     include product_id and vendor_id. Meanwhile, to work with tags
     and support pci requests based on tags, pools are ordered based
     on the number of keys of the pool. This makes sure that legacy
     pci requests will be satisfied with the pools in the beginning,
     possiblly with devices that are not tagged.

Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
Change-Id: I9da7bd921f098c958d6fb711a4d03a76862e95c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/107123/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: requests = [{'count': 1, 'request_id': 'unspecified', 'spec': [{'vendor_id': '8086'}]}] self.mox.StubOutWithMock(pci_request, 'get_pci_requests_from_request_spec') pci_request.get_pci_requests_from_request_spec( request_spec).AndReturn(requests)

subject: Add request_id in PciDevice

commit_message:
Add request_id in PciDevice

Added request_id in the PciDevice object and the corresponding
model. Migration script is added accordingly. Parent objects's
versions are bumped, and backleveling rules added.

Partially Implements: blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov
Change-Id: I2367339a29c0da8b526fd5105766e51ca4e8c6ab

commit_message:
Replace pci_request flavor storage with proper object usage

This makes the PCI code use the InstancePCIRequests object to store
and retrieve the pci_request information, instead of stashing it in
system_metadata.

Related to blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

Co-Authored-By: Baodong (Robert) Li <baoli@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I012ee5c118265e044ff41fb58b732728946ee85a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/118391/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pci_request_info = get_pci_requests_from_flavor(instance_type) 'pci_request_info': pci_request_info, pci_requests = base_options['pci_request_info'] pci_requests.instance_uuid = instance.uuid pci_requests.save(context)

commit_message:
Add InstancePCIRequests object

Part of blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Baodong (Robert) Li <baoli@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I125e4afdf98a7073abcb8117bbb7a3e3fe2f9830
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/117839/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Red Hat Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import db from nova import exception from nova.objects import base from nova.objects import fields from nova.virt import hardware class InstancePCIRequest(base.NovaObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'count': fields.IntegerField(), 'spec': fields.ListOfDictOfNullableStringsField(), 'alias_name': fields.StringField(), # A stashed request related to a resize, not current 'new': fields.BooleanField(default=False), } class InstancePCIRequests(base.NovaObject, base.ObjectListBase): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.IntegerField(read_only=True), 'instance_uuid': fields.UUIDField(), 'objects': fields.ListOfObjectsField('InstancePCIRequest'), } child_versions = { '1.0': '1.0', } @base.remotable_classmethod def get_by_instance_uuid(cls, context, instance_uuid): db_pci_requests = db.instance_extra_get_by_instance_uuid( context, instance_uuid) if not db_pci_requests: raise exception.NotFound() obj_pci_requests = cls(id=db_pci_requests['id'], instance_uuid=db_pci_requests['instance_uuid']) obj_pci_requests.objects = [] obj_pci_requests._context = context requests = jsonutils.loads(db_pci_requests['pci_requests']) for request in requests: request_obj = InstancePCIRequest(count=request['count'], spec=request['spec'], alias_name=request['alias_name'], new=request['new']) obj_pci_requests.objects.append(request_obj) obj_pci_requests.obj_reset_changes() return obj_pci_requests

commit_message:
Handle exception better in v2 attach_interface

Add more information when exception occurs in attach interface
at v2 API layer.

Change-Id: I7402cfc28d4ee7989c7eb054556df57918bbaeee

commit_message:
Adds LOG statements in multiprocess API test

Renames _terminate_workers() to _wait_for_workers_to_end() to accurately
match what is done in that method. Adds a bunch of LOG.info() and
LOG.warn() calls in the various methods in the test to get better
debugging information when bug # 1357578 rears its ugly head.

Change-Id: I6698b7c71ec651c812138c8dd93b1e1b33ee1178
Related-bug: #1357578
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/120909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
